Title: Great Culture, Great People, but Poor Job Security
Review Description: I was hired by Micron about 8 months ago. I loved my job and considered it my dream job. The opportunities for learning are limitless, and I always felt productive and valued. The people are great - I loved my manager and everyone I worked with. The culture is fantastic - the systems in place to protect the wafer and the worker are very superior to anywhere I have ever worked. Management frequently emphasizes safety, quality, and workplace performance excellence. Everyone is on the same team, and the office politics and/or backstabbing is negligible compared to everywhere I've ever been. I went on maternity leave shortly after being hired, and never felt like it might inhibit my chances of making management one day. Women are frequently promoted to management, so I was hopeful and very motivated. One negative of working there was that I frequently felt stressed by the sheer scale of the workload, so much so that I frequently skipped lunch, stayed late, and came in early. But I worked through it hoping that it would get better once the hiring freeze was lifted. In the two months before my position was eliminated, I had spent many late nights and weekends finishing up a project of fab-wide importance. The project was finally winding down, and we were ahead of schedule. I had also just won an award for quality excellence regarding my work for the automotive audit. I finally felt like I was learning the ropes of the new job and on track for promotion. Then I got called into an unexpected meeting with my manager. My position was eliminated due to random head count

Title: Management lacks at all levels
Review Description: I have never seen a more insecure executive suite. Having been at Micron since the Steve Appleton days, the current c-suite doesn’t compare. They lack coherent vision, have decimated the culture and only provide lip service to employee concerns. This isn’t the company I started working for, and it only continues to reward people that are toxic to the culture. The executive team needs to take a critical look at themselves and exit. The values are performative, and aren’t applied in practice.

Title: Highly Competitive Environment
Review Description:
Training was inconsistent and too often incomplete. This was extremely difficult to overcome in such a competitive environment.

Management did not have a good grasp of the day to day dynamics. Due to the increasingly competitive nature selfishness was rewarded. Equipment access was not equal among team members. Some team members were allowed to actively hoard and dominate shared equipment forcing others to use outdated and inadequate equipment. This made hitting weekly goals difficult. Which was used to against you in performance ratings.

Executive Management often talked about the importance of work life balance. That was not the reality. Being out on FLMA was held against your performance averages and reviews. Scheduled time off was also held against weekly performance averages. Job security is non existent.

Title: Stressful, Monetary Rewarding, Challenging
Review Description: Micron is a great place to work if you are money motivated, enjoy a fast pace, and competitive environment. The work is rewarding, most of the people are good to work with collaboratively and work under, and the salary and benefits are some of the best. They have a very limited tolerance for mistakes, no respect for work/life balance, and expect to be working at least 50-60hours a week if you plan to advance. I’d caution those applying that this is a live fast, die young environment and it’s constant state of change. If you manage to survive one of the many downturn layoffs and/or not get fired on a moving performance scale, don’t expect to have a long career. You will give 110%+ per day for years, and they will still expect more; nothing you do will ever be enough. Most of the equipment is top notch, but management refuses to hire enough people to stop burnout of the existing employees. The combination of overwork, stress, perfectionism, lack of work/life balance vs the benefits, salary, and brief moments of success will not always balance each other.

Title: Great coworkers, poor management
Review Description:
Honestly, the company would be great if upper management spent some more time on the floor understanding issues. One of the fab disciplines is go to the point of work (the floor) and I almost never saw upper management in a cleanroom gown.
The initial manager would come up every now and then to get a firsthand account of the floor and would occasionally supervise cleans and participate in the troubleshooting with the engineers at the tool, as well as watching fixes performed by the vendors. Perfectly fine and completely respect that. The manager above him only really seemed to come up when there was a lot of down tools in a given time or a tool was down a long time and only stuck around long enough for a quick explanation of what was wrong and the initial steps towards fixing it. I don't think I've ever seen a manager higher than that go to the floor, either for emergencies or to get a pulse on the work situation from technicians. Pretty sure they keep their ears closed, too. Number one complaint from the department was lack of personnel, as there is a pretty high tool per capita in the department. So the higher-ups response was to freeze hiring and then layoff people. This was in the middle of fab expansion. But they had to save costs while also having a company build a brand-new cafeteria with all sorts of fancy stuff that they already signed the contract for during covid. Like a mini dot-com bubble.
A different, more universal, complaint was meetings. They want people to pay attention during meetings so multi-tasking during them is discouraged, but this led to less time

Work/life balance is generally very good, other than their confusing refusal to enable fully remote workers. Honestly hard to get fired here other than general layoffs, so safe job security. The people are nice and most that I have worked with have been supportive and seem to genuinely care for each other's health, safety, and happiness. Food is subsidized so it's cheap ($1-2 for lunch most days). The pay is often lagging behind other similar roles at other companies, depending on the location, but the benefits are very good. Micron uses a performance grading system that doesn't always feel like it rewards a year's worth of effort and contributions.

Title: Productive and fun workplace

Title: Software Engineer
Review Description:
Review varies based on different teams.

Title: Cleanroom work is Awesome
Review Description: Fun place to work, challenging to get to speed if new. Great worklife of 3-4 days a week on 12hr shifts. Nightshift was not worth the small increase in pay as you forfeit your social life and wellbeing. Some good and some bad coworkers as usual, Management cares depending on department. Lot of room for growth and a lot of education opportunities. A very "I'll teach you" culture which will help you go very far in your career.

Title: Great place for career development .
Review Description: Manager is very helpful. Working teammates is good. Good benefits and salary. Working time is flexible. Not much stressful work. Can gain alot of working experience.

Title: Beware! Just when you get comfortable they will lay you off
Review Description: The revolving door at this company blatantly obvious from the moment you start working for this company. They lay off people all the time for no reason at all. Not a good company to work for if you need stability in your life

Title: Good culture long working hours

Strong coaching and good corporate culture..
Lack of work life balance...

Review Description: Micron is a good place to start of in the semiconductor sector. Overall my experience with them has been good so far. Managment is helpful. Worklife balance is great depending upon individual needs. Nothing hard about the work just adjusting to the type of work that is performed.

Title: Great if you know what you are doing
Review Description: Best if you understand that you should be good enough according to their needs. Otherwise you will struggle to understand the requirement. But it is not a big problem. Ok

Title: Good Place to work as an intern
Review Description: Interning at Micron Technology was definitely a learning experience. However, it is a very old crowd and I often felt like I was the only person who knew what I was doing.

Review Description: Im working here about 1 and half years as senior material specialist. The purpose i move forward to other companies due to finance growth purpose. As a senior lead, cover my 4 shift at my department. And very supportive to other departments such as stockroom, kitting and finish goods.

Review Description: Micron is a great place to work. The management is trying hard to build equality and culture. Like most companies they have a hard time recruiting talent so often the work life balance can be challenging due to being under staffed for projects.

Title: I learned a lot

Title: The culture is good.
Review Description:
They had increment for new hire after noticing their salary is not competitive in the industry which is good as they literally listened to voices from employees. The culture is good too, at least for my department. WFH is possible depending on position, flexible working hour is okay too. Opened conversation with your supervisor is very much recommended too.

Just that claiming OT is a bit hard to me as PIE. The other thing is just good.

Title: Solid place to make a career.
Review Description: As with any large company it depends on the team culture and leadership on how much you enjoy the work and the flexability for work/life balance. Overall I would recommend.

Title: Collaborative and fast paced work place
Review Description: Provides learning opportunities, fun and relaxed work environment, no work life balance but overtime benefits are available, annual bonus and pay raise available

Title: Productive and challenging work environment
Review Description: I enjoyed my job and the team I worked with. My management changed so frequently that I rarely knew what the expectations were. When I wasn't meeting expectations in my performance review my supervisor never had any feedback on how to improve. It was almost as if he didn't agree with the rating.

Title: A place that offers many perks, coffee shop, broad cafeteria, well intended people for the most part and good benefits.
Review Description: A large company feel with politics intrenched wherever you step, less than forgiving and largely demanding in conformity. A place where you can learn much ..

Title: wonderful colleagues
Review Description: on schedule with your commitments. fast paced due to the demand versus supply model. this is the norm. The company overall is not bad. would be good to include transport allowance.

Title:
The Good: room to grow into a career
The Bad: Unrealistic expectations and poor work life balance
Review Description: Micron management will encourage you to take your career where you want to go. But they will setup roadblocks in the form of unrealistic expectations, low headcount/poor support, pay raises that do not keep up with cost of living. At Micron, People is a core value, but management's lack of support for the teams shows that to be a poor lie. Work Life balance is quite poor. There is an unspoken expectation that an engineer needs to be on call and available to support project work at all hours. This leads to burnout and the current exodus from the company. In short, Micron is a good place to start your career, but don't put down roots. Plan to take your career to another company.

Title: Micron used to be a great company to work for. Now things are not the same and the environment is terrible.. Do as I say is the motto there.
Review Description: Micron used to be a great company to work for. Now things are not the same and the environment is terrible.. Do as I say is the motto there. The inclusion has gone downhill and there is more segregation than ever at the company.

Title: good company to start working with.
Review Description: The Meritocracy implemented in recent years has caused many in management to “manage by spreadsheet” and to load their teams up with only degreed engineers and candidates that fit diversity hiring criteria.

Title: Five years into Micron, immigrants friendly company. Not a company for fair career growth opportunities. Poor politics-work-life balance
Review Description: Five years into Micron, worked out be stable for me, immigrants friendly company. Not a company for fair career growth opportunities. High levels of work politics, poor politics-work-life balance

Title: A good place to work and learn from its value and culture. People working here are from diverse background and
Review Description: Workplace culture is impressive; however, it depends on where you locate. In Asian countries, work-life balance seems impossible, even an entry-level position like a production operator. Working overtime is common despite the company paying a higher rate for your extra hours. Some management sees the frequency of work overtime as part of the annual performance that will affect the year-end bonus.

Title: Fast pace manufacturing environment, not the best work/life balance when forced to support equipment on off hours. No real option for remote work.
Review Description: Fast pace manufacturing environment, not the best work/life balance when forced to support equipment on off hours. No option for remote work. Free lunches for now while covid is still surging.

Title: Breaking people instead of building them up
Review Description: Do you want to work for a company that divides their workforce instead of creating teams? Do you want to work where any means necessary is how you get things done? If so this is your place. Micron is currently experiencing a mass exodus due to how upper management is driving the company culture. While on print "People" is one of Micron's core values, it isn't how things actually work inside of the company. Massive head count restrictions mean that there is rarely the resources to meet deadlines, but you'll still held accountable to deadlines that were established outside of the laws of reality. The silos that exists between groups means that the right hand doesn't care what the left hand is doing let alone want to know about it. Do your homework and really work to understand what is happening inside of the walls of Micron before you accept an offer.

Title: Fast-paced work place
Review Description:
People culture in the company makes it a pleasant place to work in, engagement & feedback surveys are taken seriously and required to be acted upon by supervisors by the company system. For young employees/engineers, claimable overtime pay makes the high intensity & heavy workload bearable, but monthly salary (base + overtime) will be capped at 6.2k, good for fresh graduates as a stepping stone in their career. Opportunities for internal job switching are available for new experiences.

Cons

In the manufacturing field, knowledge & experience gained is very specialized for the manufacturing field and for very specialized technology. Nature of manufacturing requires 24h attention that will mean frequent losing out on rest time outside office hours as there will always be problems arising. Limited positions to climb up especially for managerial roles and above as more engineers & technicians are required due to the manufacturing nature of the company.

Title: Technician and operator are same
Review Description: a diploma holder learnt 3 years to graduate. but still works like operator. 12 hours, and no seat for technicians. if you a diploma holder and no choice working other places, then micron and other industries are the last choice. think twice before a diploma holder need to step forward into the industries. the management too much croni. the salary is good but you need to work like cows

Title: A backwater “tech” company
Review Description: Micron likes to present itself as a tech company, but it’s really a shoestring operation hellbent on maximizing profits while spending as absolutely little as possible. Budgets are constantly cut, and your human capital (read: extra hours and stress) is expected to make up the difference and make the impossible possible. The benefits and compensation package are top-notch, which is a plus, and performance is well-rewarded.

Title: Stressful work environment from management who leads by fear.
Review Description: The rating system causes people to not share information. Useless projects are mandatory to get a better than average rating. You can not be just good at your role to get an above average rating. Management style is different from one department to another. CVD department makes technicians scared to make a mistake which leads to ownership issues. Management needs to recognize individual talents. Not every technician is the same. Some are good at doing projects and some are excellent troubleshooters. To get a better than average rating you have to be good in all areas. The culture has gone down hill in the last several years. Those who came from Lehi site do not like the culture at Manassas site and a lot will be leaving when their contract is over.

Title: Its a Manufacturing Company
Review Description:
F15 in Hiroshima has long working hours, typically engineers do overtime > 40 hours (depend on team) especially if you are working directly with the process/production line. There are many procedures and communications introduced for every change.
Micron as a global company use English for internal communication but people in F15 are still mainly using Japanese in their business. Might gives a hard time for non Japanese.

Review Description: Decent pay, work is stressful . Good for fresh graduates but very stressful, may not be suitable for everyone in the long run. Overall not recommended for all.

Review Description: It is one of the best companies I ever worked for. Management is great they work as mentor. Work life balance is easy with this company. Good compensation and good culture.

Title: not worth it
Review Description:
You are paid not as per industry standards, especially when you are an international student.
Work involves long hours. Fortunately there's no on-call system.
Recently Fab 6 has been becoming too reactive for quality issues. Every engineer is expected to improve quality while juggling quantity issues. This makes the job very stressful. Opportunity to move up is also very limited.
If the boss is indian, your life can become extra stressful

Title: Nice work environment
Review Description: I enjoyed my time at Micron. My only concern was my commute and the long hrs. I don’t feel this company is for someone who has a family. If you’re single then this would be a great job. Working here I missed out on a lot of my kids lives including school functions which resulted in angry children. It took a toll on my marriage as well. I would commute from Waldorf MD every work day and that alone caused severe stress.

Title: Great place for young ambition people with no large family commitments
Review Description: Micron was a great place to work. I learned a great deal and developed from a young man fresh out of Trade School, to a seasoned Technician and Supervisor. I developed skills to use later in live when I left and started my own business. The pay was good and allowed me to save some money. The shift work can be demanding and stressful and is not family friendly when you rotate to night shifts. This job is great for a young person without a lot of family commitments.

Title: Interesting work, dry environment
Review Description: Work is interesting and employees generally are invested in their work. Extremely few technical women in engineering roles. Diversity and inclusion are starting to move forward, but feel like much more of a political show for management than a genuine investment.

Title: Productive and fun.
Review Description: Great job culture. I enjoyed my time at Micron. It was relaxed and everyone was understanding. It was not stressful and as long as you did your work no one bothered you.

Title: good culture

Title: I do not suggest working here
Review Description: Employees are not valued at all. There is very little management and they do not care about the employees. Most management has been fired, forced to quit, or replaced. The head of HR is not a nice person. No respect is shown.

Title: Long hours, conflicting direction from management
Review Description: Priorities constantly change and misdirection from leadership make it hard to execute against goals. Support of personal development is suggested but offer little time to actually focus in this area.

Title: High corporate environment
Review Description: Compensation is lower than elsewhere in the Valley. Culture is non existent. Stacked ranking and the promotion ladder are extremely antiquated. Benefits are good and what you'd expect from a company of this size.

Title: Awesome pay, good company, I'm only ok with my job.
Review Description:
Overall, Micron is a good company. They compensate well and have great benefits. US manufacturing operations continue to transfer overseas, which isn't great. If you are in a manufacturing supporting role, you can expect a lot of evening meetings and late nights. (This is also true for any role that needs to collaborate globally).
HR is pushing for a better work life balance, which many can work out. There often is flexibility in your schedule if you do have to work late. But to really advance in the company you can expect to work 50-60 hours regularly. So I don't think the culture really supports a healthy work life balance, especially if you have a family.
My direct management is pretty good. Coworkers are awesome! The company sometimes makes decisions that negativity impact employees, including occasional layoffs. I work often believing my department could be next, which is unsettling.
Work here is demanding and stressful with high expectations. But you learn a lot and gain a lot of experience if you work hard. Burn out can happen if you aren't careful. Benefits and retention bonuses are awesome, but make it difficult to consider leaving for other opportunities. My friend calls that the "Golden Handcuffs".
My job is OK. My role has changed over the past few years, and isn't as much of what it was when I applied for it. This is due to shifts in business needs, organization changes, and management changes. It no longer aligns with my career goals, but still giving me good experience until I find the right job and make a change.

Title: Communication is the key
Review Description:
Micron was a position that I had sought for some time. an international company headquartered near my home, that was willing to let me use the skills I have, and learn the ones that I don't. Overall the experience was one of the best that I've ever had, and would take it again if given the chance.

BUT, you do have to talk to people, and ensure that they understand what you are saying, and the same for you. Communication is a two-way street, and there has to be a "meeting of the minds" at some point. And know that if you go too far ahead of the curve, you're on your own.

Expectations are high, and the culture of the business is deeply entrenched. Change is tolerated, as long as it works out of the box, with few errors, and NONE that bring the system down as a whole. Communicating with your supervisor is always a god thing, but it can also become a double-edged sword if not done properly. Assumptions need to be left at home, far from the workplace, because anything can change on a moment's notice.
Pro: Strong, cohesive teams with common goals, and often common skillsets. Cross-training, and mentoring opportunities
Con: Poor requirements, nearly impossible deadlines, and no understanding of how to function with Agile software development techniques.

Title: Great benefits, structural problems
Review Description:
Micron is a fast paced semiconductor manufacturer. they'll train you on your toolset, they'll give you great benefits, but they've got one major flaw.

They cant trust, or keep, good technicians.

Micron has fantastic work/life balance- we work 12s, but we get 4 days off one weekend, and 3 the next. most of us prefer this schedule to a regular 9-5. they have lots of great benefits like employee stock programs, great healthcare, and they offer 12 weeks of parental leave for both women AND men, so if you're thinking of having a kid in the next few years, you'll be hard pressed to match that. You get a crazy amount of paid time off on top of that- so much that people often have a hard time taking it all. You also get 100 minutes of break every day (only 30 minutes unpaid for lunch) The pay is less than other comparable semiconductor manufacturers, like intel, but that isn't their problem. Their problem is inherent with the organization and how upper-middle management works

you can be a fantastic employee, and you can suggest lots of solutions to large problems, but if its not something you can fix yourself, it won't get fixed anytime soon. They constantly ignore the existence of massive, department and fab-wide problems, and if you bring them up, you're suddenly the bad guy, and it doesn't matter because they don't want to address them. They want to put on a nice act for their bosses, and their customers. Further than that, you'll find that getting much needed help on tool problems is problematic at best, because the engineers are much too pre-occupied with attending meetings - 
more...

Title: Interesting work, continuous development required
Review Description:
A typical day at work will include several repetitive tasks, such as changing tool consumables. In addition, you will likely always be required to do something that you don't know how to, whether it is administrative (generating parts reports), or troubleshooting something faulting.

You learn/adapt fast, or perish here. If that's for you, then you'll do very well.

Culture is VERY mixed from top down, which is to say, the top doesn't care about anything the bottom does. Your immediate boss, and the person above them will care that you're well-off at your job, anything above that will view you as a number, and will make your life a nightmare just to fit the bell curve.

Hardest part is also the best part... which is schedule. it's 12 hour shifts, but compressed work weeks. Each shift is long, but each weekend is either 3 or 4 days, alternating, with either 3 or 4 day work weeks.
Pro: Right now, free lunches if you're on site
Con: inadequate manning, lack of training

Review Description: Overall, good place to work, but management quality can vary wildly across departments. Management is careful to not leave any "paper trail" of reviews, so arbitrary action can always be taken against an employee.

Title: Mostly hire contractors
Review Description: Micron mostly hires contractors through employment agencies for the majority of positions at the company, such as production. I worked in production and it was a mess. The company gets grandoise ideas on taking the company in new directions, focuses on it for a year or two and then releases all the new hires they brought on for the project so they can focus on something new and save more money. The real thing that bothers me about this practice is that it doesn't even count against their bottom line when they let go so many workers because they hired them through independent hiring agencies are paid by separate companies (such as Kelly Services). If you work here, don't plan a career around it, no matter what they tell you.
Pro: The cafeteria at the Boise location has above average food.
Con: No benefits, job security, decent pay, opportunities for advancement, or flexible schedules.

Title: Good Pay for Incoherent Product Development Processes
Review Description: Processes are changed from project to project and year to year. Management acts impulsively and often lacks the technical expertise to make good choices. This was my 2nd highest paying job ever, so money was not a problem.

Title: Micron is an overall great place to work.
Review Description: As a technician in the clean room fab, my typical day included monitoring computer based systems for down equipment and responding to said equipment. Micron provides all the training needed to complete the daily scheduled and unscheduled tasks. The best part about a career with Micron is the friendly work environment and benefits this company provides. Some days can be more stressful than others as with any other work place but overall my experience with Micron was positive and exciting.

Title: Productive and fun place to work
Review Description: Very good at develop people in the company. Good benefit and pay. Ping pong table in the break room. Work with many different back ground people and different culture people.

Review Description: Great place to work if you’re looking for a set full time job. Long working hours but given long weekend. Could take up personal life as hours are 12 hours a piece.

Title: Nothing... I would not recommend this company to anyone.
Review Description: Micron only cares about their bottom line. They do not care about the quality of their product. They care about their employees. They do not have great advancement opportunities.

Title: It is a great company to work for!
Review Description: I loved working at Micron! I only left to pursue a different career path. I highly recommend to anyone. They appreciate individuals who are hard-working and with good work ethic.

Title: Good for new graduates. Lacking career progression for experienced staff.
Review Description:
Plus points:
Good mentorship for new hires. Culture of sharing knowledge allows one to quickly assimilate into a new role. Lots of cross-department projects to gain understanding about the work of different teams. Salary is good among semiconductor companies. Company makes it a point to celebrate important milestones and are willing to spend money (such as booking the whole Universal Studios for a day) to do so.

Minus points:
Except for a select few teams, generally very stingy about providing training opportunities. Middle management has the mindset that all skills (including AI and Deep Learning) can be mastered through one week of googling or a few high-level internal sharing sessions, and naively expects to see such mastery quickly. This frustrates employees who feel that they cannot grow in their roles.
The campaign for work-life balance is just paying lip service. Poor work-life balance for any role that supports production line. And middle management makes no attempt to improve the situation. Initiatives from top management are good but middle management adds 101 'buts' to the plans, basically to say that they won't carry out the directives.

such a nice environment and can get good more knowledge and circles.

He missed meetings, never prepare his own materials during presentations, picked on me like nobody business like shouting during morning meeting, arrange for late meeting for more bantering session for an hour. Even my team ever approached me to ask if i have crossed him in anyway or perhaps had dated his daughter before. In a year there, i lost hours of sleep and was diagnosed with hypertension.

The money and benefits are good, but prepare for the yearly appraisal. Grade 2 and below will be dismissed if you do not perform with a few months.

When I first started I quickly realized I was only one bad manager away from hitting the road. When Micron brought in a couple of headhunters from Lehi I knew my days were numbered. I had always been rated in the 4 range in their 1 to 5 ratings, 5 being the highest, suddenly I'm a 2. Title: Decent workplace/compensation, company is working to modernize
Review Description:
The worst part about Micron is the culture. There is an overwhelming atmosphere in many departments that solutions need to be as complex as possible - for job security, and information needs to kept internal as much as possible - to claim credit for accomplishments. There are various reasons for this, and some are valid and appropriate (such as limiting data access for security reasons), but many boil down to petty office politics and international culture clashes. In general, the company culture issues are between teams and larger organizations, not individuals.
Otherwise, compensation seems pretty fair, and you get the feeling that upper management is legitimately working to modernize and scale the company, as Micron's historical business strategies (buying up all the competition) don't really apply anymore, and many of the original/older employees are retiring or being retired.

Title: Busy, productive and fun.
Review Description: Working with a team of professionals who are there to support one another. The work is challenging and fun. International work is a plus. Great learning environment..

Title: Bell curve rating system that cuts employees every year
Review Description: Micron bases their yearly reviews off a bell curve system that promotes silos and destroys collaboration. No one is helpful because if you succeed they can get a lower rating so everyone is against everyone. Ratings are based off the bell curve so it doesnt matter how you do all year round it's based off how you compare to your coworkers. Also, the yearly reviews are based off the bell curve and every year right before Thanksgiving they fire the low performers to prevent paying bonuses.

Title: Productive work environment with an excellent culture and promotes new ideas
Review Description: Interns at Micron are given a main project over the summer that is valuable to the company, achievable, and valuable to the intern. The hardest part of the job were initial projects or activities that I had little to no experience/exposure to; however, this gave me the ability to learn all new concepts. The most enjoyable part of the job is the learning. Throughout the internship, I learned many valuable skills that will help me in the future, no matter what career path I end up in. Title: Great learning experience
Review Description: As an Intern at Micron Technology one can learn a lot. Working there has opened my eyes of how much effort goes into making micro chips for the everyday technology we use i.e. Laptops, Smart phones, Vehicles and Tablets. Working there was a fantastic learning experience, its just too bad that the micro management was not worth my sanity. I worked for the department of Photolithography and while it was great while it lasted you truly feel as though you are being criticized behind your back way too much. The company is great depending on what department you work for but please be cautious for there are no cameras in the facility due to confidentiality sake. Ergo the people talking behind your back becomes a game of telephone all the way to your manager.

Title: Productive and challenging
Review Description: Working as a process Engineer nothing was the same day to day. Always had challenging tasks, training personnel and continuous learning opportunities.

Title: Chanllenging and tense
Review Description: Chanllenging and tense but salary is not bad. You have to keep moving to keep the abreast of your peers and your boss too. To be calm while facing issues.

Title: Challenging place to work
Review Description: Challenging place to work, life and work balance is awesome, lots of things to learn on the job too. I would definitely recommend the company to anyone.

Title: Always worried about lay-offs
Review Description:
If you are in the US, there is a risk that your job will be moved to Asia.
The Performance Rating System is designed to rid the company of a % of lower performing workers. However, that philosophy implies that yesterdays good and valued workers become todays lowest performers, regardless of actual job performance. It is not a measurement of performance, but a constant and mandated purging of the lowest performers, no mater how good they are.

Title: Good workplace with lots of perks
Review Description:
Even though workload can be a bit too much, there are other perks like an on-site gym, quarterly bonuses, employee share options, and profit-sharing incentives. Work culture is good as well.
I couldn't continue working here because there are limited options for advancement in career.

Title: Unstable Environment, Unsuitable for Entry-Level Employees
Review Description:
During my time at Micron, I noticed a few key Pros and Cons:

Pros:
Good pay and benefits
Excellent Location

Cons:
Constant cost-cutting initiatives and fear of offshoring
Defensive, fear-driven mindset stemming from fear of offshoring
Focus on diversity initiatives instead of substantive benefits to employees
Brain Drain in progress, as experienced employees retire and are replaced by new grads. Minimal support offered to new grads.

Title: Micron is a demanding company the culture is very stressful
Review Description: Micron employees are a good group to work with. The management is not realistic in their expectations. Some training is given, but often not until deadlines are delinquent. There is an undercurrent of age discrimination that is felt especially if you are white male.

Title: Able to multi task and learn a lot from the work
Review Description:
I have learnt to work under stress and able to multi task.
My job had made to me to be more friendly with other department people also i have to work along with other colleagues to get work done. It is a nice company to work and very well managed work timing.

Title: Was a great place to work.
Review Description: The culture has degraded. No longer a good place to work. Downsizing and moving equipment and people to other sites that need it more than Utah does.

Title: Stressful and fast paced workplace, however people around make the work enjoyable
Review Description:
Positives
1) Great collaboration between inter department teams
2) Great employee benefits such as medical, AWS and performance bonus
3) Allows employee to internal jump between departments after a period of employment

Negative
1) Fast Pace and stressful
2) Lots of documentations needed to make a change
3) 24/7 Operational
Pro: Good collaboration between teams, Good employee benefits, allows employee to internal jump between departments
Con: 24/7 operational, KPI Driven, lots of documentations needed to make a change

Title: Great company
Review Description: Great Tech company offering full benefits, retirement plan, stock options and internal advancement opportunities for all employee's around the world in multiple locations.

Title: Working with multi racial people
Review Description: Dynamic and challenging work environment. Good place for learning and skills development. It was positive to be part of global company and gain wider cultural perspective.

Title: Would like to go back
Review Description: Great company to work for I enjoyed the day to day challenges. Training was adequate but could be more available. Safety was always first and equipment made available. I enjoyed working with the shift and advancing my knowledge in the semiconductor industry.

Title: Very good company to work for until latest CEO's arrival
Review Description: I enjoyed my time at Micron, I enjoyed it enough that I went back after being laid off and would go back again if the opportunity presented itself. Work life balance was good even though a technical role required 12 hour shifts, 3 on 4 off and 4 on 3 off.

Title: Challenging and Dynamic
Review Description: Dynamic and challenging work environment, good place for learning and skills development. It was positive to be part of global company and gain wider cultural perspective.

Title: Fast pace and competitive working environment
Review Description: Attractive salary but high-pressure working environment. Competitive among colleagues, the opportunity of growth is low. Staff benefits are good, facilities such as gym, studio, small table tennis court are available.

Title: Can be a good first job
Review Description:
Busy place
Lots to learn at work
work-life balance not best
good benefits
culture of the company can be improved
Lots of contacts can be made
Employees do not seem very excited to be there
Lots of layoffs

Title: Enjoyable work. Poor management.
Review Description:
The day to day work is enjoyable.
Annual employee reviews are not a review of your work, but a review of how popular you are and if you had any mistakes over the year.
Frequent layoffs, or layoffs disguised as "early retirement" or "poor performance review"
Pay is sub-par for the area. Pay increases of only 1-2% are considered large, even though they don't cover cost of living increases.
Interactions with immediate co-workers are great. Lower management is good. Upper management considers everyone to be just a number not a person. The only time they seem to care is when its the annual internal review of their performance.
Real solutions to problems are not wanted by management, only solutions that look good on paper, because the solutions aren't implemented.

Title: Hiring Freeze
Review Description: Great place to work, but due to the fact that they are shipping all the jobs to Hyderbad, I am not able to get hired on as a full employee. I would love to work here.
Job Title: Senior Instructional Designer, Training Analyst, Knowledge Base Architect

Title: Not Great for Creative/Innovative People
Review Description: Micron in general is a great place to work. They try to hire the best technical people and are at the top of the game in the semiconductor business. My particular experience is probably outside of the norm, since I was hired to work on essentially a skunkworks project, but I found that the management is too much "by the book" and does not foster an environment of creativity and innovative. Instead, they have resorted to a "management by spreadsheet" mentality, which works for a manufacturing-oriented organization, but not a world-class engineering organization. All of that said, I would likely give Micron another shot if the right opportunity came along.

Title: Productive but Stressful
Review Description: Meetings after meetings, Long hours, plenty of data mining, data analyzing and decision making. Steep learning curve with never ending learning opportunities. Friendly and helpful co-workers only if they are free. Celebrations after celebrations and recognition after recognition could get in the way of work at times.

Title: Loved working for Micron
Review Description: Work environment was fantastic. I loved everything about this job but due to my growing family I needed to find a job that paid more. If I were to ever move back to the Boise area this would be my first choice for job searching.

Title: Good compensation but stressful at times
Review Description: A lot of bureaucracy to sort through, constant threat of bad performance reviews or layoff brings stress. Late hours for meetings on a weekly basis. A lot of emphasis on emails and presentations (managing your manager) instead of the actual work.

Title: Internship
Review Description: Interesting and challenging place to work; daily interactions with machines kept you on top of your skills. New challenges with said machines to inspire troubleshooting and problem solving. 12 hour work days with on site cafeteria provided and quiet rooms to relax in. Management was always helpful and looked for your best interest and let you know what it took to advance in the company. This was the only real experience I had in my electrical engineering field and i enjoyed it very much.

Title: Discrimination of Foreigners
Review Description:
Micron does not hire people from abroad, only hiring local people for the roles they advertise, and I mean, not even PR's!

They should state this in their adds, do not apply if you are not Singaporean, would avoid waste of time filling the job applications.

Title: Good pay and benefits but in this large corporation you are a number.
Review Description:
Micron offers good pay, benefits and bonuses and opportunity to grow and advance; depending on your department.
However, many jobs have been moved off-shore to "low cost regions" and for the past five years with the new CEO this has been excellerated. You cannot count on a long term career. When the opportunity comes to replace you with lower cost personnel that is the end.

Title: Very dynamic job
Review Description:
While working with various groups, processing international and domestic shipments I learned how to implement problem solving
abilities with very little or no supervision. It's a good atmosphere to work in.

Title: productive and fun workplace
Review Description:
good workplace culture, learned many things, very enjoyable to work for.
good management, good hours, hardest part of the job is lifting things, job is easy.

Title: Really normal place to work
Review Description:
Advantage: suitable for new hires who want a high salary by doing OT
Disadvantage: No potential of advancement and not suitable for personal development.

Title: Very good experience
Review Description:
San Jose site is so great and I enjoy working there a lot. People there are very friendly and the work is able to finish.

The corporation housing is so great and they provides free rental car.

Title: Stressful and fast paced workplace, however people around make the work enjoyable

Positives

2) Great employee benefits such as medical, AWS and performance bonus

Title: Great team member work enviornment.
Review Description: Micron had great benefits and was great to its team members but always felt like walking on eggshells not know I g if and when you are going to be laid off. Which eventually happened to me.
Pro: Health care benefits were great!!!
Con: Nothing I can think of. Micron is a great company to work for.

Title: A good start to one's career
Review Description: A very good starter for fresh graduates. Pay and benefits are superb, if you are in managerial positions and above it will be a whopping deal. Be prepared to work long hours.

Title: Was a good working environment.
Review Description:
Micron was a good place to work. Great people to work with. team environment.
Management was always flexible and considerate.
Workplace culture is shifting. but that is expected as with job requirements also changing.

Title: just like most companies
Review Description: They don't care about you at all. they will use you until you are a wasted husk. A typical day is working like a slave for nothing. Management are idiots. Its awful.

Title: Productive
Review Description: Typical work day is rarely typical, constantly changing and shifting priorities often within the same day. The hardest part is shifting from night shift to day shift every 4 months.

Title: Good teams but volatile industry.
Review Description: The semiconductor market is extremely competitive and requires Micron to continually change so don't expect job security. You will find creative people with strong work ethics who are generally enjoyable to work with and the opportunity to advance your education and career.

Title: Personal and communication
Review Description: Excellent work environment. People willing to work with you. Multicultural atmosphere. Environment friendly. Chemical background required to understand the relevant work which consisted of manufacturing processor chips for computers.

Title: Fun place in a great area
Review Description: I loved my time there and all of my coworkers were nice. I learned a lot about software design but I had no struggled to understand the layout of the building. I would recommend this company to anyone.

Title: Great Benefits
Review Description: I saw many changes at Micron in my 31 years there. Some for the best and some I didn't agree with. Overall it is a good place to work and they have provided me with the skills I possess today.

Title: very productive
Review Description:
friendly atmosphere with well sophisticated office
can get chance to share our knowledge and develop skills and enroute our career
enjoyed working alot

Title: People are great to work with but company ideals have changed significantly over the years.
Review Description: Micron used to be known as a family oriented business. Now they squeeze every possible hour of work from their salaried employees while continuing to reduce the workforce instead of increase it.

Title: Good company with reasonable benefit
Review Description: Micron is the best place to learn new thing related to electrical and mechanical platform.Its complete with productive and advance technology.They offer a good salary package. I find micron is the best company to work. Company also providing training to the staff to increase knowledge.

Title: Hit and miss
Review Description: Micron as a company is doing what ever it think it need to obtain profit. Lay-offs and replacement is prevalent and the shrinking of benefits are continuous. If you get a good leadership team above you, you are luckier then most. The current CEO likes to get recognized for profit but he will do it at the expense of the employee.

Title: No job security
Review Description: The morale is terrible because of the rating system at Micron. No matter how hard you work you can be let go at anytime because Micron has to meet a % quota.

Title: Extremely Productive and fast paced industry
Review Description:
A typical day in Micron,Singapore mostly starts with looking at the data or yield percentage or deviation in line. Experience might vary from one engineer to another. Some engineers requires to work in line,while others need to concentrate in data mining and data optimization.

There are several meetings through out the day. Some of the meeting are important and informative,while some are redundant.

Managers are prompt in addressing an issue and acting on it immediately.Top management puts a lot of pressure on the directors/managers and engineers to fulfill the target by/before the target date.

Most managers and directors do not believe in the term 'work-life balance'. Engineers are expected to bring back their laptops home and work from home on weekends .

Micron provides many on job training,but the quality of the training completely depends on the trainer.

Since there is a lot of pressure from day to day,the learning curve is extremely steep. The job requires an engineer to align with cross functional team, to analyze data, to collaboration with team mates , technicians and operators, to understand minute details about processes and tools etc. So however the pressure is, at the end of the day the pay is very good and there are many opportunities to learn and rise up the ladder.

Title: Interfacing with customer and Resolving problems.
Review Description: As an Account Analyst working with multi million dollar accounts on a daily basis. Worked with several department resolving customer RMA's and deduction on accounts. Created daily reconciliations of chargebacks and notifed sales of disputes as needed. Contact customer and resolved disputes. I enjoyed working with customers and the challenge of resolving problems for them.

Title: Not good culture
Review Description: The team I am working with works on custom flows which are not used in industry. Hence, my experience didn't gain much value in the market. I am planning to leave this job.

Title: Not a permanent hire
Review Description: It was a great contract gig - but i am not sure how regular full-time employees are treated. It was a dynamic work environment - and It was great to work in a place that tried to stay culturally relevant

Title: Good place to start
Review Description: Good place for a fresh graduate to learn about work life. Many cool projects can broad people's mind. Have on-calll duty for engineer but they will give good pay for this.

Title: Collaborative and Fun Work Environment
Review Description: I liked working at Micron Technology for the summer internship. The teams are good and collaborative. There is good work-life balance and I would love to return back for Full-Time.

Title: Good culture, friendly, productive
Review Description: When I was there a good team atmosphere prevailed. There were activities, such as company sponsored picnics, and also ping pong and basket ball. There were also events where people were brought in to show us new technology, like 3D printers. The team atmosphere helped get work done, and helped employees advance in knowledge and in their contributions to the overall effort.
Pro: Fruit Friday, training for equipment
Con: I was a contractor and was to stay that way

Title: Micron technology
Review Description: It was a pretty easy job. I had a great team which made everything much more fun. It is very competitive and must be a very detailed oriented person. I worked at nights, which I liked.

Title: A good company with lots of upward mobility available if you should so choose.
Review Description: An employee will not go wrong if they choose to work at Micron. They really are one of the best games in town. Ypu can place faith in the culture and employees and follow well.

Title: Micron Review
Review Description:
There are game rooms.
There are mini marts on campus at various locations.
There are two cafeterias with dining outside available.
There is a recreational area, and weight room, and medical facilities on site.
There is free fruit on Fridays.
Working remotely is allowed.
Work is 24x7, most support is over seas so it will eat heavily into evenings. Paging at night is constant and required to be answered in 20 minutes.
Meetings are often and support tickets flow in continuously but are not expected to be used as excuses for missing deadlines on projects. You will be rated against your peers so no matter how well you are doing the actual job, if your peers are doing it better you'll be let go. Annual reviews are done on a bell curve. Someone will always be rated a 1 and let go every year. No job security beyond one year of work. August to Augutst.

Title: Not the same company
Review Description: 20 Years ago Micron was a great company, new management wants to move everything overseas. They are actively trying to outsource areas which I find vital not to outsource

Title: technical know how
Review Description:
technical capabilities
career growth
location
facilities
compensation and benefits
education
competitive work environment
management structure/alignment

Title: Challenging and rewarding place to work
Review Description: Company balances employee well being and business achievement. Company goals include People, Innovation, Tenacity, Collaboration, and Customer Focus.

Title: Changes and Lack of Direction
Review Description: Constant organizational changes, no clear and concise method on being super successful day-to-day. Focusing too much on money instead of quality will unfortunately be the ultimate downfall. Great experiences with the people but the management has been very tough to stomach sometimes. Thankful my supervisor was great but the other departments have caused many issues because of personal outside issues. This is definitely a family business and they hire they relatives to come in who don't deserve the position. Brings down the moral of the team and departments this way.

Title: Was a nice place to work
Review Description: It was a good place. People I worked with were fun , worked to gather as one , everybody help and work together as one. To get products shipped out. It was a good place to work.

Title: Ok
Review Description: It’s really very top heavy in management and the fab support technicians are so full of drama other than that good place to work. Easy to work harder than others but hard to stay away from toxic people.

Title: Overall it was a bad experience
Review Description:
From the first day I knew something was up. I was so excited to start this contract, but from the first day there was this sense that I wasn't needed. There was poor communication between my direct manager and myself. My emails would go unanswered and his interactions with me were very brief and terse. This caused me great anxiety from the start, because I had just come from a large successful project where I was the lead and knew the entire system inside and out. So I went from being in charge of a large important project to feeling like I was silo-ed and shut out. My manager couldn't careless. He was either too busy or just didn't care.

The team of developers I worked with were good smart and talented... but the projects and work were inconsistent and at times aimless with vague requirements and no demos to show off progress... it all just felt like a waste of time.

This was a short term contract so I can't complain too much... but a week before they let me go, they told me that they had extended my contract for another year. So it was a big shock when the next week they turned around and let me go. Evidently it was due to budget cuts and even my direct manager wasn't aware. At least that's what I was told.

Title: Casual and productive work environment
Review Description: The team was fully professional and casual; cubicle environment was shared by all except for the Director. Lots of virtual meetings with teams in England and the West Coast.
Job Title: Senior Engineering Manager, Next Gen SSD

Title: The company has lots of layoffs
Review Description:
I liked my jobs there. The compensation is very good. The management planning lacks foresight so job security is unknown.

I would work at Micron again because the work is interesting. I know they are not hiring.

Title: Analyst
Review Description: I was excited to work for Micron and thought I'd be able to retire there. No such luck. I was forced out about 2 years ago. They are outsourcing every position that they can. Jobs are going to China, Mexico, Malaysia, India, etc. They are recruiting fresh college graduate students for cheaper pay. Don't get fooled by working for this company. The Headquarters are based in Idaho, but Micron is hiring 1,000 in San Jose and 2,000 in India. I doubt they will be in Idaho for very much longer. Potential employees beware!

Title: Company
Review Description: Micron is a good place to work. With a lot of global opportunities. But the work / life balance is challenging. With long hours, travel, and evening conference calls.
Job Title: Sr Manager of Stratigic Program Management Office

Title: Hard work with deadlines
Review Description: Lots of hard work with deadlines that are not flexible - poor job security due to forced ranking to meet 10% annual layoff quota Supervisor was forced to change my review to meet department quota

Title: Very nice place to work
Review Description: Very nice place to work, both the benefits, the salary, the building, the teamleaders. I found nice people working there and I like the enviroment. Only problem was location, the territory, which was not the best, with the best people. But overall was a great job and a great opportunity. Very high satisfation.

Title: Great place to work. Good people. And challenging and cutting-edge technology.
Review Description:
Working at Micron is great. The Boise campus is beautiful. Working in the administrative areas affords team members the opportunity to have slightly more flexible work hours. Team members who work in the production areas have more rigid hours; but they also have longer weekends (3 and 4 days).
Aside from the daily challenges that result from developing the world's most advanced semiconductor products, team members can also get involved with continual improvement and safety projects. There are many opportunities to make a positive impact to the success of the company.

Title: Mediocre
Review Description: There wasnt much if an interview process for them, I started working after the staffing agency placed me . The work overall isnt a lot, it is repetative. The staff

Title: It's a job. Do the job and avoid the drama.
Review Description: It's a job. Do the job and avoid the drama. There's a lot of drama at the company and with the managers. It's important to stay focused on the work and avoid the petty turf wars.

Title: Great people to work with and benefits
Review Description: Good place to work for benefits, great people, and learned something new almost daily. Learned to work with various people and groups, whether it be problem solving or working to move product along in timely manner. My team members were amazing and fun to work with. Hardest part of job was worrying about job being outsourced.
Pro: Great benefits, 2 big lunch areas for breakfast/lunch options, workout centers
Con: bad rating system, jobs being sent overseas

Title: Some of the employees were great to work with. Some are just brilliant and I have been in high tech. a long time. Great technology.
Review Description: Not a place where you can learn and develop. This is the reason I left. They hire the skills they need externally. A lot of companies these day do this so not picking on Micron. Again, some amazingly talented people to work with. Some great managers also.

Title: New leadership in the past 2 years has completely changed the culture at Micron. Some of it good, some of it not.
Review Description: Micron has been a great place to work, but significant changes in the last 2 years with new leadership. Rank and file people are great to work with, and the best part about working at Micron.

Title: Good place to work.
Review Description: Good place to work and learn if you're in the chemical engineering field. Company likes to promote from within so opportunities for advancement are available.

Title: Excellent place to grow
Review Description: i worked at a team where we were a bunch for friends, all working together towards the same goal. Excellent work environment, challenging, fast paced yet without any pressure.

Title: Job security not good
Review Description: They employed a forced rating system to save money on biannual profit payouts. (Jack Welsh plan) Some leads resigned because they refused to lower a subordinate's rating falsely.

Title: Average company
Review Description: This is an average company, with many layers of management. The technical opportunities are good, but not enough direction on how to apply technical details to the everyday work environment.

Title: Excellent.
Review Description: Great place to work. Slow paced at times. Good environment. Not much touch with management. Good pay, and interesting projects. Needs to move faster...

Title: Wore A Bunch of Different Caps--Overall Fun Place To Work
Review Description: Micron was an awesome place to work! I worked as a contractor, so there was no job security :(. I gave my job 110% at all times so that if a position opened up, they would see my job performance and hopefully pick me as the new candidate! I loved what I did! I performed the security of visitors and/or employee access when badges were forgotten. I helped onboard new employees by using E-Verify and assisted with new employee orientation. I was the front office "face" greeting the public, employees, visitors and vendors. I handled all shipping/receiving utilizing ShipDoc and ShipOut including complex international shipping. I assisted upper management with calendar events, and completing expense reports as needed. I utilized MS Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint daily! I had many different responsibilities, but I loved it and it kept me busy at ALL times! The days just flew by when I worked there! I would love to work for a company with a cool culture and a lot of work to do!

Title: Fast-paced environment with many opportunities to learn and grow
Review Description:
Fast-paced environment
Many opportunities to learn and grow
Intelligent team
Innovative company
Focus on productivity, accountability, and results
Rewards

Title: Good for fresher
Review Description: Work is repetitive and intentionally long. Long working hours, restrictions on OT and no work life balance. Management is helpful and they let you grow if you're a right person

Title: Enjoy my co workers schedule isn’t always the best
Review Description:
My co workers are great, and for the most part everyone I’ve had to interact with outside my department has been great, and extremely helpful.

The shifts to provide decent amount of time off on between tours but depending on which end of the week your shift falls on can interfere with home life. So far that’s my only gripe job pays well, and provides great benefits

Title: A good job, but very little job security
Review Description: I enjoyed my time working at Micron as a Production Operator. I was employed there twice, and was able to grow my career the first time I worked there by becoming a Trainer and a Lead Operator. It seems, though, that the company cares more about the bottom line than about its employees. I was laid off from my first position with the company, due to shutting down a portion of the production line rather than upgrading their machines, and the second time the company again shut down the area I worked in, opting to send it overseas for cheaper labor.

Title: fear motivates
Review Description: You have to have a submissive personality and put up with managers that have no idea how to manage. Much of the workforce works out of fear. Great people here and there, but overall a very toxic environment

Title: Efficient and empowerment workplace
Review Description: employees are empowered to make decision, good leadership, and productive work culture. Fast pace work environment and tones of exposure. Full of training programs.

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: There is a "good ol' boy" attitude among management. It makes it difficult to succeed. Lots of opportunities for personal growth. Don't expect raises.

Title: Would not work there again.
Review Description: Was a great company. New CEO has completely destroyed the Boise site. He sold out on the last company (SanDisk) and took the money and ran. I believe he will do the same to Micron. Stay away from Micon until him and his crew are out. Once Micron goes into the red, the for sale signs will be up and it's only a matter of time.

Title: Very Techy
Review Description: It is a very routine job and company so do not expect Micron to be like Google or Microsoft. However, I have nothing but complimentary things to say about Micron. The employees here are very forthcoming and nice.

Title: Fun and professional place to work
Review Description: I enjoyed my time at Micron by learning project management, new script languages, onsite support calls and supporting sharepoint architecture team. Also I grew myself to another level by joining sharepoint conferences from microsoft.

Title: Nice working enviornment i love people.
Review Description: Working at Micron was a great experience I learned how to do a lot of hard task and accomplish many goals it was a very fun job atmosphere a lot of people there to help

Review Description: Can't tell the future and nobody really knows either. Layoffs as needed by management. You just keep working and keep your head down. This is not a friendly place to work.
Pro: none
Con: unknown future

Title: Family like environment. Made lots of great friends.
Review Description: There's always going to be positive and negative things with a large company. Great work and great co-workers. If I had more to say I would say it. As it is there is nothing else to say.

Title: Good company to work for
Review Description: Good company to work for. Great work life balance. Management could be little old school but lot of potential to grow.Friendly environment with stress free work culture

Title: Lousy culture and peer bully
Review Description: no work life balance. some senior peer even will bully new staff. Long working hours sometimes even no rest for 12hours. Lousy mentoring also. Little benefit.

Title: Work is fine but the company culture is non-existent
Review Description:
Nature of the work and the type of products I worked on were fine.

The compensation is good for the type of work.

But the company will suffer in long term because of its weak company culture. Nobody talks to you even if you try to initiate a conversation. People are worried only about their work and there is no human exchanges here.

You work like a robot and get paid for it.

If you are spending more than half of your waking hours everyday at a place, you need to have humans around you not robots.

Title: Excellent company
Review Description: I loved working for Micron. Absolutely excellent company and people and great work. Nothing but good to say about them and the opportunity they provided.

Title: Good company to work
Review Description: Good company to work, professional environment, good salary package and benefits..Micron provides lot on trainings and encourage employes to attend classes..

Title: Productive and fun place to work
Review Description: Meh. I have worked in better places and worse. People are for the most part very good to work with. Some of the things I was told at hire never came to fruition as the processes were constantly in flux.

Title: The benefits are worth the workload
Review Description: Some management could use some better training on workload management, but the benefits and pay are overall great. Your paid what your worth even if sometimes your being to job of several people due to lack of hiring replacement personnel.

Title: Good Place to work
Review Description: Micron is a great company to work for. Very fair company, great work schedule. 12 hour days could be long, but you are always busy, machines are challenging

Title: Micron was a great company to gain work experience
Review Description: Loved working at Micron till CEO and management changes 2 years ago. Micron gave me 12 years of sales and operations experience that I hope to take to a new company. They also provided me the opportunity to go back to school to obtain my bachelor's degree.

Title: No work-life balance or career path
Review Description:
I've heard there are groups that are good to work in... I didn't see it.
The hardest part of the job is putting in the effort for people who respond with hints of moving your position overseas.
The most enjoyable part is seeing your product in the store.
After a few years, despite all the motivational talk, I realized the silo mentality is killing the company. The silo leads to managers more concerned with validating their existence than understanding what their employees do and how to make improvements. We routinely worked with other groups who had no clue we existed or why we were necessary to the process. Towards the end, I realized our own manager didn't understand our primary process or even the meaning of the acronym. (It's a bit like discovering your football coach doesn't know what a touchdown is.)
The old guard tells stories of working their way up from operator, bonuses, and employee patents, but that was before operations started moving overseas. They are too busy "cutting costs" to see it is bleeding the company.
It seems that the managers ignore the human factor of their employees. I.e. balancing authority with responsibility, maintaining employee morale, fatigue, work-life balance, career interests.
My group experienced 4 or 5 reorgs in 3 years. After 3 reorgs, we were back where they started. Each time, we were told our jobs wouldn't change. Mostly, the reorgs created chaos and allowed the transient managers to add to their resume.
Our boss in Asia hired new teammates over there, gave them clear assignments and promotions, then let us languished.

Title: Environment changed
Review Description: New CEO changed the way people worked, made people compete against each other for their jobs. Moved jobs over seas and doesn't just views the people there as a tool.

Title: Productive and fun Technology company with work/life balance
Review Description:
Micron is a great place to work. They care about their team members and encourage advancement within the work place
They have onsite fitness centers and games

Title: Hated it, almost the worst environment on the planet
Review Description: Some of the worst management on the planet. The worst management on the planet. They find the absolutely worst, arrogant, abusive, incompetent, politically vicious, executives, and promote them to the highest levels. Never want to work there again. They will tell you this is an outlier review. I am one of thousands of employees with this experience.

Title: Way to many hours
Review Description: Nice people, etc. But the culture expects a LOT of overtime. People are trying to take vacation per a mandate, but have to work even more overtime than the 50 - 70 they do already-- just to be able to take their vacation. Not good or right at this or any other company.

Title: Repetitive
Review Description: Shipping department is repetitive. I worked as a temp for 10 months, hoping to be hired by Micron. I learned everything i could, only to be told we are closing our doors at the warehouse to move the shipping department to mexico.

Title: Micron contractor HMC
Review Description:
Micron does not hire direct, but through contractors, so if and when they have a downturn, it is easier to cut staff.

The typical day is 9-5pm
Culture is diverse and Global
Global communications so 24/7 support
sometimes difficult to communicate to Indian staff

Title: layoffs occur regularly and without warning
Review Description: layoffs occur frequently and without warning. Lots to do on campus and there are two cafeterias with good food. Disk golf course, baseball diamond, soccer and frisbee, a complete gym with on staff chiropractor, and a health care center.

Title: It was a good career
Review Description: The work was variable lasting between 10 and 12hrs per day. I learned everything there was to learn to be an effective member of the team. the management team was approachable and I learned a lot from my manager. The culture at Micron is variable depending on the department. Corporate Micron is working to change this to one culture but, it has not been effective yet. The hardest part of the job was coming in and wondering when an exit date would present its self. I enjoyed the people/family that came for working at the site.

Title: Stressful and fast paced workplace, however people around make the work enjoyable
Review Description:
Positives
1) Great collaboration between inter department teams
2) Great employee benefits such as medical, AWS and performance bonus
3) Allows employee to internal jump between departments after a period of employment

Negative

2) Lots of documentations needed to make a change
