Title: Fast-paced work environment with strong emphasis on team work.
Review Description: Micron was a great place to work, with great people and many benefits for it's employees. I learned a lot while I worked there and Micron encouraged my personal development. Towards the end, there were some policies that were implemented that seemed to be directed at creating turnover rather than rewarding loyalty. I still think it is a great company for a career minded individual.

Title: Manassas plant
Review Description: I worked here just over a year. The overall culture of the company was positive, but it did seem to lack that "family" atmosphere that I had at a previous semiconductor company. The cost of living in Manassas is fairly steep and the salary was not enough for me to be able to move there. I tried to make the commute, but it proved to be unsustainable.
Pro: Fairly relaxed atmosphere
Con: Salary not in line with cost of living in area

Title: Good work place
Review Description:
Monitoring cameras
Activating and deactivating badges for employees
Greeting
Responding emails, Skype for business
Directing if needed
Dress professionally

Title: Excellent pay and benefits but poorly managed employee review program.
Review Description: The employee review program requires that all the employees fall within a bell curve and are rated on a scale of 1 - 5 . The percentages of employees falling within certain points of the curve is mandated by upper management. Therefore, your rating is determined by this mandate rather than your performance. This creates a very competitive environment and low employee morale.

Title: Okay
Review Description:
Okay
Great Time off program.
Great Medical and heath benefits.
Always enjoyed working with the production personnel.
Interesting place to work in a Manufacturing setting.

Title: Good company in Semiconductor
Review Description: Micron is one of the largest company in semiconductor industry. The benefits here are good. But the work-life balance for some departments is not very good. OT payment is provided.

Title: Diversity
Review Description: They tolerate people with different background. Many learned from each other and how to be better at being productive. I overcame my personal flaw and able to perfect it. Things such productivity and challenging myself to be a better person.

Title: A challenging place to work.
Review Description: This is a challenging place to work. There's more focus on getting as much as possible done and less consideration on how to develop leadership and collaboration.

Title: Leading manufacturer of memory devices.
Review Description: It takes a very strong work ethic to work for Micron Technology. for United States locations and global positions expect evening hours for calls with sites in Taiwan Japan and Singapore.

Title: Steer clear of Micron, they’re on their way out
Review Description:
Micron is a hard company to work for. They have periodic lay-offs, so there is absolutely no job security.
Advancement is near impossible, because they cut costs by hiring interns right out of college instead of promoting the educated and experienced that have already been working there and have proven themselves. The management is more concerned about their parking spots than actually leading a team. It’s a very negative environment and I’m happy to be away from there.

Title: Micron Technology Inc
Review Description: The company states that it values it's employees and their contributions, but the actual practices do not show this. The compensation is slightly above average for the industry but the workload is beyond intense. The work-life balance at Micron is 90 work - 10 life if you want to have any job security. Their new focus is on automating most of the support positions and those that cannot be automated are being out-sourced. If you are not an engineer or designer I recommend looking elsewhere.

Title: Good for people starting out
Review Description: Good place to start in semi but that is it. Promotions are political or on buddy system. Geared to move Senior Techs out the door. Lack of knowledge of techs on shift makes hard to learn.

Title: Fun Place
Review Description: People are serious in their work, but can still crack a joke. I learnt a lot, from how to deal with issues to how to make use of software to process information.

Title: Fun and Fast Paced place to work.
Review Description: I enjoyed my work very much. I would recommend them to anyone. The competition can be tough but great performance is rewarded and opportunities to excel are available.

Title: Nice to place to work
Review Description:
It is a good company to work in. Due to its location work life balance is good.
The office location is also very good.
The company uses multiple technologies so you can get chance to learn many technologies.

Title: Good learning environment to gain experiment
Review Description: good to start your career after graduate. But less opporturnity to continue developing since all the job scope assigned is narrow and depend on the top tier vacancy.

Title: Very productive
Review Description: Great company to work with. I learn a lot working with Micron and provided lots of training for employees that will like to grow and learn. provided different paid classes like computer, English, trainer, electronics that will help us grow with the company. The company also provided lunch to all employees and great bonuses.

Title: Good Company. Poor IT Department
Review Description: Management provides very little support to their direct reports in the IT department. Other departments are well managed but the IT department is not well respected or managed.

Title: good work life balance bad opportunities for growth
Review Description: I was able to develop and acquire new skills during my time with Micron. Leadership was very approachable and personable. However, there are few if any opportunities to move up the ladder

Title: fun/interesting
Review Description: I enjoyed the learning curve/ the people and when I finally worked a day shift position the hrs worked out better for family. The benefits were good and gave stock options to people in leadership.

Review Description:
In IT domain, most manager has no domain knowledge or engineering mindset but has great power for decision like hiring.
No hiring criteria and never take responsible for decision.
Pro: Paid good
Con: Poor management and engineer culture

Title: Strong company
Review Description: Great company to work for, and lots of fantastic people. College opportunities available. Micron discounts throughout Boise for merchandise at local businesses.
Pro: Stock options and benefits
Con: Short or no breaks

Title: Fun Place to Intern
Review Description: I enjoyed the daily routine at Micron. Arrival time to work was fairly flexible as long as I met the required weekly hours. Immediate management worked closely with me, and we worked together frequently; however, I never met my actual manager. The hardest part of the job was leaving at the end, and the most enjoyable part was the skills I gained for my career.

Title: A place to work and learn at the same time
Review Description: I have learnt on how to manipulate problems based on the situations, and working under pressure where we have reach the weekly production target while ensuring the quality of the product is in top.

Title: Global Work Environment
Review Description: A global work environment can be very challenging and a bit overwhelming when attempting to achieve clear communication and overcoming an extremely diverse set of culture values and belief systems.

Title: Will always love this place ❤️
Review Description: I really enjoyed my time here at Micron. If they didn't lay us off I wanted to make a career out of it. My department was laid back they trusted us with breaks & lunches ( ex. 60 I could take it all at once of 6 10 min breaks). I would recommend this job even with the layoffs. I will always cherish my time at Micron.

Title: Mostly typical for a semi conductor company
Review Description:
They enjoyed getting rid of people. I saw many exited and ended up a casualty.

The cafeteria at the time was quite good.

Boise is a lovely place to live.

Cost of living is reasonable.

Virtually no place to go if you end up on someones dislike list.

Title: Started out good
Review Description: Typical day at work was reviewing ticket queue. I would frequently schedule appointments with the clients to review their tickets. Generally speaking, the clients were easy to work with.

Title: Emplyees Challenged and well taken care of
Review Description: Be a self-motivator and you'll do well here. There are a lot of old school workers here, so mindset is slow to change. They seem to be going for more college-educated candidates, even over just the last 5 years. We love our CEO

Title: Productive
Review Description: Friendly, productive, good benefits. I have learned a lots from this company. The directive managers were good. Only one bad thing with me was seeing co workers/friends being walked out time by times last few years.(And then me at last!)

Title: The bean counters rule the roost
Review Description: If there is a way for the company to save a penny, even if it means moving jobs overseas to countries that have little to no experience they will do it. No one's job is "safe" anymore and having a "career" is impossible.

Title: Nice place to start learning
Review Description: Micron is a nice place to start a career. The seriousness culture cultivates serious talents and helped to build a future for young engineers. The industry relies on precision and working with high precision is sometimes stressful but will be better as the learning curve kick in.

Title: Started out great and turned into the same as any other Global company.
Review Description: I worked at Micron for 23 + years. It started of great and slowly changed over time to be the same as any other Global company. There is fair compensation and great benefits.

Title: Good People and the work pushes your limits
Review Description:
This is a really good company to work for and has great benefits. This industry will push your limits and you will develop many skills based on the work environment.
Most of the people are great to work with and are well educated.
Work Life balance is often difficult and often work goes home with you. There is a forced rating scale to turnover the workers regularly in order to try and get new people hired.

Title: Formerly great place to work
Review Description: Has been a great place to work for most of my time, many strong people and good friends. Recent changes have seriously eroded the culture which makes it a difficult place to work.

Title: Used to be a destination
Review Description: Work environment and compensation/benefits used to make Micron one of the best employers in the valley. Sad to say that is no longer the case. Oh they will hire you and make you feel important but the second they can figure out a way to do your job Taiwan or China on the cheap you're history.

Title: Productive and fun workplace

Eventhough everyone in the office was busy and was not in the same team but they all willing to help me and cooperate with me to do the job right. Worked in Micron not only have daliy mission but also will have the team work activities, this really help everyone in the team to work together and relationship getting closer.

It was a pretty good company to work for, for most of my career there.
The new CEO is moving more and more jobs overseas.

work here base on trust.

Title: Decent place to work
Review Description: Decent place to work with good benefits. Pretty good work/life balance. It really came down to the area and shift you worked on. The good thing is that company provided opportunities for movement into other work areas.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: Micron was a pretty decent place to work. I was required to work seven days over a two week period and they were pretty lenient with authorizing their employees wishes to work additional overtime. The only drawback to working there was how they performed their promotions.

Title: Productive work place and culture
Review Description: Great place to work !! Boise is a small town but the work is great with good growth prospects. I would strongly recommend anybody working in the field of semiconductor manufacturing.

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: Micron is a great place to work. They allow for advancements in careers if the employee takes advantage of it. The benefits are the best around. I would highly recommend this place.

Title: Great benefits and great shifts to work.
Review Description: I would still be working at Micron if they would not have moved overseas. The shifts you were given to work allowed great family time. The vacation pay and bonuses were great.

Title: Great internship opportunity
Review Description: Typical work days included working on tasks assigned by manager. Waiting for new tasks to come up. Learned SharePoint and another new software. Management was amazing. My manager and my managers manager were great people. Culture was positive and all my coworkers had positive attitudes. Micron has developed a strong culture and those who have been there speak highly of the work they have done. The most difficult part of the job was the little bit of off time waiting for someone to deliver something. The most enjoyable part of the job was the overall experience of working in a amazing business and having co workers who make the time that much better. 10/10

Title: Great company to work with
Review Description: I interned at Micron as an intern in the Business Development Org. Program was structured but at the same time I had the freedom to chose projects of my choice. Management was helpful and supportive.
Job Title: Business Analytics Intern - Embedded Business Unit

Title: summer internship 2018
Review Description:
to gain knowledge and industrial skills.
to learn new experiences from teammates and others
8 hours working per day. however, you can come to work early and leave early too.
everyone is so friendly and be help when you need

Title: great place to work
Review Description: micron offer each employees to grow at their pace.I had learned leaderships skills and able to work with other team that also strengthen my people skill.

Title: Nearly 20 years
Review Description: Micron was a great company to work for. The industry is volatile though and it has its highs and lows. Industry wide layoffs were common and aside from that, the company was awesome to work for. Safe and clean work areas and the employees were awesome.

Title: Productive, Great Culture, Great Teams.
Review Description: Worked as an intern for one year at Micron Technology. Gained lots of team-working experience as an intern in Fab Support. Using different programs to update and check status of different tools down on Fab level and on Sub-Fab Level. Great place to work and a really great culture. Also have family history who had worked at Micron. Management on my team was a really great guy, who always gave me proper instruction, in the nicest way possible. The most difficult part about this job was when you perform Progressive Maintenance on Sub-Fab level tools when they are alarming or down.

Title: Challenging work environment with limited upside
Review Description: Micron is a company full of many great team members that are a lot of fun to work with. The working conditions at Micron have become challenging with uncertain and changing expectations being set by leadership.

Title: Technician
Review Description: This was a successful employment opportunity that lasted approximate 6 years as I was employed here twice. I am an excellent employee. If I didn't have to move I would still be there.

Title: too much tribal knowledge; no peer mentorship
Review Description: tribal knowledge driven. sink or swim attitude. good pay but you have to dedicate yourself to many long hours self learning. Zero idle time and full throttle high tech constantly.

Title: Worst company and work culture
Review Description: Micromanagement client, who doesnt care about your skills or knowledge but only focus for your email writing and timings and being online. No welcoming nature for newest member of the team. Talks something in front of you and something in back of you.

Title: Challenging and working with good people around you
Review Description: Most days were different depending on the state of the many equipment in the dept, My typical day would with a passdown from the previous shift technician since Micron Technology is a 24/7 manufacturing company, I will then work on any equipment that are in need of repairs and then proceeded with performing PMs on equipment that required it. Management for the most part will leave alone as long as I am keeping myself busy.The most enjoyable part of my job is the interaction with my co-workers.

Title: Productive
Review Description: My experience at Micron has been a productive fast paced environment with plenty of opportunities to learn about new technology if you are willing to put in the extra time.

Title: Was a great place to work
Review Description: Used to be a great place to work. New CEO has introduced a culture that is toxic and and places more importance on diversity than results. Would no longer recommend Micron as a place to work.

Review Description: Good place to work, friendly people, experienced and good management always ready to help. The job itself (production) is not difficult, requires to play as part of the team. The working hours are suitable for all people (even those who get childcare commitments).

Title: Good Place to work and intern
Review Description: Good Place to work and intern. Employees are very nice and helpful. They are always willing to go the extra mile and help you out. Company is just on top of things and has good leadership.

Title: productive, fun and good people
Review Description: it was a good time to work for Micron, my co-workers was very nice and i learn a lot from the company. yes we do have 12 hours work but at the end the day you don't feel it because the people around you.

Title: Fun Place to learn and apply knowledge.
Review Description: Conducive environment for both working and learning. People are really knowledgeable and also help you to understand the concepts well, in case you are in doubt.

Title: Work Hard
Review Description: The work was rewarding, but the fear of termination is not a fun part of the work environment. With the new CEO there is less communication from top management and it is less predictable what will happen.

Title: split shifts are required for technicians
Review Description: Good pay, 12 hour shifts are tough but doable, rotating from days to nights every 4 months was extremely hard on the body and mind. Always on your feet. My manager was not good but others are.

Title: Not a bad job for the area, extremely stressful and cut-throat if you're hired through a temp agency.
Review Description: An alright job if you would like to know about the industry and possibly a career, however you are initially hired through a temp agency and as such you have no benefits and are at the bottom of the food chain.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: Good place to work, good culture good pay and benefits. Work life balance is pretty good. Time off plan is great if your job allows you to use it. Overall good experience.

Title: Good Team with work environment that promotes learning
Review Description: The job is very fast paced, as is typical with semiconductor industry. The leadership is style is open and technical discussions are encouraged. Provides lot of scope for learning and opportunities to grow.

Title: Micron is a company that focuses on the mission statement; all departments have a line-of-sight to company goals.
Review Description: A typical day is reviewing and discussing safety protocol with the team. Communicate expectations that align to the daily and weekly goals. Provide team with consistent communication of progress towards goals, and company updates.

Title: Poor management & working conditions
Review Description:
Plant located in Manassas, VA. My was in the inspection of chip wafers. Twelve hour shifts were to long and poor management.

Moral was low and turnover was high. The workplace culture was not good. I learned I should acquire new endeavors.

Title: IT is all about checkboxes and tickets
Review Description:
No interest in finding root cause of problems, or how pervasive the problem may be. No regard by IT of how activities performed by IT may adversely impact daily tasks of everyday users.

Lately micron is on some quota kick whereby management is REQUIRED to give 5% of direct reports a less than passing evaluation- whether they deserve it or not. Once given a less than passing grade, employees are then presented with two unappealing, motivation killing, options.

This quota for this year is 5%. Next year will be 7.5%

Work hard all year, only to find out the last week of the review period you have been selected to be part of the 5% quota - even if you have received stellar reviews for the previous 25 years.

Title: Technician Level 2
Review Description:
Day: 12 hours of troubleshooting. Expect each day to be different and demand different skills.

Learned: Integrated Systems/Chemical Handling. You will become versed in most work sets and if you can comfortably work on a car then you have the right mind set to work on the equipment.

Management: Good nature on the bottom, irregular on the top, and stake holders are held dear on the top. Don't expect favors or emphasis on employees. They are tightening the reins on the community which is shifting how the people react. A lot of reactionary changes happen and seem loosely thought out.

Culture: Techs are close knit community and will help each other out. Laziness gets rooted out pretty quickly as each person is needed.
Expect it too be almost solely OJT with another person.

Hardest part of the job: No tech manuals or schematics. A lot of tribal knowledge happens.

Enjoyable part of the job: No tech manuals or schematics. You'll be using your head a lot along with your hands to figure out why certain chemical residues happens and how best to deal with it one hour or the next fix a turbo.

Title: Excellent place to work with team atmosphere
Review Description: I would have never left Micron if I didn't have to. Unfortunately my job was transferred to Taiwan so my entire department was forced to find new jobs or take a severance package. I loved working for Micron although the job security was tough. In my almost 4 years of working there I witnessed 6 layoff periods and then the department transfer. It was tough to constantly go through or be nervous if you would have a job or not during the next layoff.

Title: Used to be fun but has become a toxic environment to work in.
Review Description:
Flexible work hours but plan on being required to attend late night / early morning online meetings and be on call 24/7.

Typical day starts with early morning meetings.

then some sort of agile standup that can to for over an hour.

Lunch if you have time, we do have ping pong tables and game rooms but very little time to use them.

I normally leave work early but have after hour meetings and support calls during the night and weekends.

Title: Slow paced. Long days.
Review Description: Third shift worked 4 10s. Was a good gig until the company sold and new management was horrible. They will tell you there is room for advancement but there is none.

Title: Professional Staff
Review Description: Overall, bad work experience. This is a toxic work experience. If you have new ideas and stand out, be fearful. You are viewed as aggressive. There is no diversity and overall, there are bullies in management. I did not learn or grow and will be out in 2019 as soon as I find another job. The benefits are good and pay. The company culture does not provide work life balance although there is a policy for it. If you are an intern seeking experience, this is the place to come and then leave and work for another tech company.

Title: Good company to work for (based on previous upper management)
Review Description: My experience with Micron was very good as a long time employee. This was a company that started in Boise, Idaho and expanded world-wide. It was a good company to work for, but involved a strong commitment from it's people. I do not have any information on the current state of Micron after the change in upper management around 2017.

Title: Professional and detailed oriented company
Review Description: Training can improve. Great working environment. Vacation time accumulates very rapidly. Very clean and healthy working conditions. Very professional and detailed oriented company. Three day work with four days off rotating. Very secured and safe environment.

Title: Management only worked for themselves
Review Description: Job was good. How employees treated very bad. Management and supervision worked on buddy system and looked out for themselves. Shipped jobs overseas

Review Description: Management preaches that the people are important but practices the opposite. They set the workers up to cut each others throats with their new "bell curve" review rating system. They have no touch of reality.

Con: Everything else

Title: Plenty to Do
Review Description:
Working on projects for managers,
working on completing new contractors for managers,
ordering supplies,
ordering catering,
booking conference rooms,
booking venues,
submitting work orders to get requests completed

Title: Productive work environment with onsite healthcare, fitness, and ping pong tables
Review Description:
The above states the meat and potatoes of what an employee needs.
It was an amazing place to work, except for the constant possibility of being laid off. Which happened, they chose the pacific realm for cheap labor.

Title: Favoritism, nepotism
Review Description: Employee ratings are rigged for the sake of company profits. It's not how hard you work, what's your skill level is, or your potential but who you know. Favoritism and nepotism run rampid there.

Title: Changing work enviroment, moving low level Engineers into positions their not capable of.
Review Description: I have not recieved any training to do my work. What I've learned I've done on my own. Micron management doesn't support the employee when abnormal situations occur. The employee is on their own in meetings with hire level management

Title: Average work environment
Review Description: Typical technical writing environment. Tasks are routine, tech writing team is great, but engineers can be difficult to work with. Management is not very supportive.

Title: Other Departments Were Good
Review Description: Ended up with a really terrible Manager at the end of my career at Micron. Really left a sour taste in my mouth about the company. I used to love working there, even got my wife a job there. Now she is dealing with the same thing. Micron really needs to eliminate the bad seeds that have wiggled their way into leadership roles. They give the company a bad reputation.

Title: Ok place to work
Review Description: good place to work, just too much going on with the way they are rating and having to meet the bell curve. They are setting people up for failure without even noticing

Title: Exciting and fast paced environment moving to cut throat culture
Review Description: Micron Is a fast paced, highly collaborative environment to work in but recently has moved to a cut throat environment under the new CEO’s direction. If you can’t take the heat, get out of the kitchen is what he likes to say when asked about the new environment. The benefits and compensation are very good, but with this new culture, the job security aspect has taken a big hit, and in an area like Boise where there are few jobs that have comparable compensation, it puts employees with families at risk of having to move every review period. So if you are single or comfortable with that type of work culture, then Micron is a pretty good place to work.

Title: Productive and fun working environment
Review Description: Good training course provided. My family problem is settle.I was give birth baby was caesranMy supervisor said can join back to micron. Please let me to join back. I'm able to speak Chinese.

Title: System maintenance
Review Description: Start with pass down then collect proper paper work start with daily routine which continues though out the day until we prepare for the next shift pass down.

Title: Always wanting to improve
Review Description: They always tried to work with you on work and family life. had flexible shifts. were willing to work with you on special needs. Bonuses were not always punctual always changing .

Title: Micron Boise
Review Description: Very flexible work schedule depending on the position. Work duties tend to be both wide in terms of scope and deep in terms of knowledge base. Mobility and career track could be improved. Cannot beat Boise for a place to live and work.

Title: great place to work
Review Description: micron is a great place to work is started with little to no experience in the semi conductor industry and learned a lot in just the first 6 months of employment

Title: stressful
Review Description: Being able to learn all I could about chips for computers and how they work, was the most exciting. Having a good leader to try and advance myself was very hard.

Title: Good benefits
Review Description:
I worked at Micron for 19 yrs. Grateful for the job. Made it through numerous layoffs, except this one. Looking for work after 19 yrs.

You need to enjoy change, there are always new products, new procedures, new employees.

Can be mind numbing work. Boring. Lots of repetition. Tendinitis is common. 12 hour days working with same people.

Title: Great place to work, until recently.
Review Description: 30 years of service. Didn't cross my T's and dot my I's to satisfy my middle,middle, middle, middle, middle, middle, middle manager. Was a great place to work back in the day.

Title: Great place to work and grow.
Review Description:
I worked for Micron as an Application Engineer for 4 years and felt it was the best environment I had worked in. The people I worked with were exceptional and were eager to help when asked.

Management was always available when needed and did not get involved otherwise.

Title: Good to learn on how computer hardware work in-dept
Review Description: The work environment here is very self motivated. You will have a mentor to teach you for how the process work. After that you would need to use your knowledge to show your ability to work on your own. You need to ask senior to fill your ability to perform your job.

Title: Stressful and fast paced workplace, however people around make the work enjoyable
Review Description:
Positives
1) Great collaboration between inter department teams
2) Great employee benefits such as medical, AWS and performance bonus
3) Allows employee to internal jump between departments after a period of employment

Negative
1) Fast Pace and stressful
2) Lots of documentations needed to make a change
3) 24/7 Operational
Pro: Good collaboration between teams, Good employee benefits, allows employee to internal jump between departments
Con: 24/7 operational, KPI Driven, lots of documentations needed to make a change

Title: Competitive, fast pased, appropriate tools and applications provided
Review Description: Typical day included numerous meetings for design reviews/sign offs on plans for tool installs and upgrades. I maintained my Microsoft schedule that was driven by delivery dates from vendors. Coordinated with project owners to ensure I included their needs in the design/upgrade. I learned how to maintain 60+ projects simultaneously to include updates, date moves, additional requests. The management was always quick to help and provide input regarding tough decisions and modified completion dates. The hardest part was keeping up on numerous change requests and date moves. I enjoyed working with all the trades. I worked in facilities and I had the opportunity to work with all departments and trade groups.
Pro: Opportunity to work with all departments
Con: Typically huge work loads

Title: Awesome
Review Description: I Loved Micron. 19 years and 10 different positions. It was a way of life and I enjoyed it all. I would love to go back but am not sure that I can after my time off.... If I could there is nowhere I would rather be.
Pro: The challenge.
Con: The challenge.

Title: Productive workplace
Review Description: My experience working at Micron was excellent. I loved working 3 days a week on one week and 4 days on the following week. It provided the time for me to run personal errands and health appointments without having to take a day off. The company took care of the team members by providing health fairs and other events. Micron gave me the opportunity to work overtime.It was an amazing work experience that I miss. I wish the company had not left Puerto Rico.

Title: Best company I have ever worked for!
Review Description: Micron provided me with the best opportunities for learning, developing management skills. Including helping with educational assistance. Micron was also a pleasant place to work and not only allow you to help the company, but also help yourself in many aspects of human growth Best company I have ever worked for.

Title: Finish goods operator
Review Description:
Making up kits for jobs as per route cards process using sap ,package,label and send through for shipping.
Good place to work ,made good friends there ,would go back if there was a position available.

Title: Great team, poor management
Review Description: Blessed to have worked with some of the most intelligent, supportive, intuitive, and helpful people in the industry for over 17 years. Company supported continuing education, but unfortunately career placement or opportunities for advancement were very undermanaged. Work was fast-paced and challenging, but that's what drives the "doers". Losing a lot of great people due to manufacturing transfers to Asia.

Title: fast paced, stressful
Review Description: good pay and advancement if you are a hard worker, but you will continue to be pushed until you are burned out. not ideal place for someone with family bc you will never see them.
Job Title: New Project Coordinator/ Post Electrical Lead

Title: Great place to work.
Review Description: I have enjoyed working for Micron for the last 18yrs. I have no Idea what else to say about a company that I enjoyed working for. The Management has always been far.

Title: Prroductive
Review Description: Good stable job to have if you do your job correctly. It's a good stable job as long as you learn and do your work correctly. I appreciate the opportunity to have worked for the company.

Title: Your Job Satisfaction Depends on Your Department
Review Description: Micron can be a good place to work for if you get into the right job. For such a large company too much of your advancement and compensation depends on who your manager is and your department.

Title: Average pay, overall good work culture
Review Description: This is a typical old school large MNC - very stable, good work-life balance, but your pay may be crawling a bit. Of course depending where you are in the company things can be very different.

Title: Micron is a good company to work for
Review Description: I like my job in Micron and people work around me but this company is moving to Taiwan so I have to find a new job. I learned many things since I had worked there: Running many kind of technology machines, technology chips. Inspected products for defects, quality. Handle machines and chemicals, set up and verified equipments

Title: Micron has very demanding expectations
Review Description: Micron has very demanding expectations. They place an unreasonable burden on employees by consistently leaving the staff with less people than it requires to complete the work. While offering training courses, no one has the time to take them. On the job training is inconsistent and poorly coordinated.

Title: Good place to work.
Review Description: Good place to work with good people. We worked on rotating shifts and are busy constantly. The management is caring and supportive of the people that work there.

Title: Micron was a great place to work, I worked in the SSD Dept. while they developed an SSD program.
Review Description: I was the first TCM hired by Micron to help develop their Customer Base and get product qualified by new OEM's to their SSD customer base. This was a great place to work while helping other departments learn how to get product qualified at major OEM's. This part of the business was being treated as a "Start Up" business within Micron Technology, I enjoyed this as it was a new experience for me to be in a start up environment.

Title: Work can be stressful, but rewarding
Review Description:
This is a company where every role counts and every person understands their impact to the bottom line. There are many positions where leadership through influence across multiple organizations is required.
Management wants to be kept abreast of progress toward strategic and tactical goals on a constant basis. Both high level and granular detail level communication capability is required.
The people at Micron all want to succeed. While there are always more initiatives than resources, the leadership does a good job of setting or supporting recommended priorities.

Title: Good solid Company
Review Description: I enjoyed working for Micron. It was a professional environment and great place to work. They hire many positions from within as you grow and are ready for more and new responsibilities.

Title: Culture in Micron
Review Description: It is quite pleasant working environment with people focused one. They respect each other and is given some room to think about the job more creatively.

Title: Ok to work
Review Description: This is a company ok to work for. They used to require badge in and badge out, now they don't require badge out. New CEO promoted many Indians people.

Title: Great group of co-workers
Review Description: Micron is a fun and innovative place of employment. The people are great and the culture is diverse. I appreciate the flexible work environment and having the ability to manage work/home life.

Title: Great Company
Review Description: A truly a delight to work for such an organization at has weathered the years of competition from such challenging market place. A truly an honorable and a delight to work.

Title: Excellent place to work at
Review Description:
Excellent company with excellent benefits
Teamwork oriented
Employee focus
Well balanced
Excellent opportunities for advancement
Excellent business culture and environment

Title: Interesting place to work!
Review Description: Landed at Micron after from an acquisition. Integration was slow and current employees were not very welcoming. Communication styles were very different. Overall was an OK experience.

Title: Overall company is good
Review Description: Cutting edge technology at micron helped to learn how data is significant in life.Overall structured organization has more system in place helped to learn more things

Title: Fast paced and great pay
Review Description: Micron is a great place to work. It is fast paced and very hands on. You get to work with some of the brightest individuals around. The pay is good, and benefits are great. Having 3-4 day work weeks is a plus.

Title: Micron, in Boise, is a shadow of what it once was
Review Description: When I started at Micron in 1997, that was the place to be. It was fast paced and busy, with good pay and benefits. I'm sure the shareholders are making good money now but it's no longer a good place for employment unless that's all you can get. There is the constant fear of another layoff consistently looming over your head.

Title: Micron life
Review Description: Micron is a good company for the area. They pay well and have a good paid time off program. They have good management in most areas and work with personal schedules well. They pay for going back to college if industry related and you maintain a passing grade of C or better. All in a not a bad company to work for but limited growth if you don't have a BS degree.

Title: Good Company to work
Review Description: Good company. Allot of training. Good benefits. Competitive salary. Opportunity to improve and build career. A very diverse company. With jobs all over the world.

Title: No work-life balance
Review Description: Very difficult to balance work and life and expectations are not in line with what is told to employees. As the company is doing well, most jobs are being moved to Asia.

Title: Fast, dynamic company
Review Description:
Fast, changing company within the computer memory industry.
Steep learning curve at the beginning
Salary is competitive within semiconductor industry
Job security

Title: Productive and fun. Many opportunities for advancement.
Review Description: Would always recommend Micron as a place of employment. Looking for a challenge and fast pace environment would recommend applying at Micron. Good support in advancing career opportunities.

Title: Currently stressful - Not much fun.
Review Description: As Micron continues to push more operations off shore the sites in the US are viewed as unnecessary. This is having a negative effect on moral here in Boise.

Title: Good place to work with decent benefits.
Review Description: Fun workplace with good people. Too much training of non job related subjects and not enough training of work related tasks. Lots of paid vacation with average benefits.

Title: Fast Paced
Review Description: At Micron, I worked in a fast paced environment, cleanroom atmosphere where I maintained and serviced equipment used in the micro-chip manufacturing process of 300mm silicon wafers.

Title: Good and Bad
Review Description:
Some of the Best Managers and some of the WORST.
In general, not a bad place to work, but there is a LOT of stress in some groups and some really poor managers.
They are trying to improve, but still having issues.

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: The experience was very rewarding. I held multiple positions of increasing responsibilities which has positioned me very well in the field of Operations Management

Title: The Last US Semiconductor Company
Review Description: Micron is a large company with a diversified team member demographic. Micron is large enough to allow movement from one career to the next if you get bored!

Title: Top heavy management
Review Description:
It's impossible to cover a typical day based on the wide variety of jobs. It's possible to learn a great deal at Micron, but it's not always easy as time is closely monitored.

Management is extremely stratified there. When a manager causes profound damage to an area, they are shuffled around. This causes a plethora of moves as people try to avoid working under the worst managers. It’s a very unpleasant place to work if you get under on of the managers who starts every conversation with, “Well back in Fab 1 we…”

There are good managers, but they are scarce and someone above is always looking to move a friend into that position who needs a fresh job.

Title: Fast paced and long hours
Review Description: If you like to work on technical problems and with a diverse team, this is the place for you! Micron hires bright people that have storng work ethics.

Title: Nice company to work
Review Description: Great company to work. Target oriented company. Very focus on work. Always work on root cause of the problem and solution. Great documentation for future used. Vacation and Holidays are Great. Good 401K matching.

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: The job was a little changing but very rewarding, it definitely has everyday applications to it and teaches you useful skills. the shifts are perfect in my opinion 12 hours 3 days on 4 off flips every week to 4 days on 3 off. I enjoyed and wish I would have been able to stay.

Title: manufacturing technician
Review Description: co-workers are wonderful and the new upgrades they are doing will really benefit the company. It is sad that so many people are losing there job however they are upgrading.

Title: Good place to work.
Review Description: Good place. Enjoyed my work. Enjoyed working with my peers. Had opportunities for continued education. Good benefits. Was always informed of company progress and informed of business.

Title: Productive fun loving place
Review Description:
A place where you can work with best in class people with extremely good work/life balance. Competitive salary benefits.
A place where you can work with people from all over the world.

Title: It is what you make of it.
Review Description: Plenty of opportunities to prove yourself and work on cutting edge technology. Some groups are more demanding than others. Due to the nature of this worldwide company, many meetings outside of typical work hours.

Title: Laid back work environment
Review Description: During a typical day, you are given what you need to complete and are on your way. You are given 2 breaks, 1 before lunch and 1 after. The day typically goes by quickly, as you are occupied by work. Not too much down time.
Job Title: Fiber Tech/ Forklift Operator, Shipping Clerk

Title: Great place to work!
Review Description: The environment at Micron Technology Inc. is inclusive and rewarding! Great pay, benefits and culture. There are a lot of ways you can grow with this company and a lot of people willing to help you achieve goals and climb the corporate ladder!

Title: Good but could be a lot better
Review Description: With the idea that people don't work for companies, they work for managers; Micron has some room to grow. Management here is stuffy and work can be very silo'd.

Title: A company with the correct mindset towards team members
Review Description: A company that took care of their team members, it had the correct business culture, a place to learn, clear goals and development path , right business structure, had a correct training structure define. A company who shared their wins with the rest of the team not only with top executives.

Title: fun work place, clean , good management, but not good and safe for contractors
Review Description: fun work place, clean , good management, time paid of , a lot of hours if you need more hours its a good place for micron employees but not good and safe for contractors

Title: A great place to work.
Review Description:
Operate and maintain equipment within manufacturer’s and company’s efficiency guidelines. Assist shift engineering by performing post down tool qualifications or special process
testing to investigate down tool situations. Computer hardware and
software support, typing, and working with Microsoft Word and
Excel. Serve as an area mentor when called upon to train new
manufacturing technicians.

Title: Great Company
Review Description: This company is a great place to work. The pay and benefits are great and the corporate culture is geared towards the employees. I strongly recommend this company.

Title: Technician 4
Review Description:
My job was very rewarding. I worked in R&D and production working on semiconductor tools. It was very interesting working and learning about the latest technology.

The management team worked closely with technicians on career paths within the group. Technicians could work from Tech 1 up to Tech 4. There was departments, corporate and personal goals that helped achieve the top bonus money and raises.

The technician teams was a close group. We all had similar work ethics and got along great.

It seemed like we were always learning something new. New tools arriving, vendor training and Engineering experiments.

The time off was great... working 3-4 days a week on 12 hour shifts. Benefits where excellent.

Title: Terribly corrupt management, no structure.
Review Description: This company only cares about making money. That's it. Lower level employees are swept under the rug, and given impossible chances to move up. Unless of course, you're in the "good ol` boys" club. The wages are so terrible, the department I worked in had a higher turn over rate than a McDonalds. The only thing this company has going for it, is the benefits. I can't argue that they're top tier. The people I worked with were wonderful people, but the management was absolutely awful.If the last job on earth was at this company, I would not go back.

Title: Great Company
Review Description: Micron will provide the necessary tools to help it employees get ahead in their careers. The workplace culture is laid-backed with a heavy focus on staying ahead.

Title: trainer
Review Description: Awsome company to work for. fast paced . worked in the clean room but they took really great care of its employees. Great insurance (i got sick).still a wonderful fast paced work environment loved it and would go back !!

Title: Sending Jobs out of the country again
Review Description: Micron used to be a great US Idaho based company. It hardly has anything left here in the US. Just about everything at this point has been out sourced to other countries. Would not recommend if you want any job stability.

Title: Great place to work for the area.To bad they took all manufacturing off shore.
Review Description: Great educational opportunities. Could take as many company provided classes as you want at no cost. Was a very good place to work for the area. Excellent pay and benefits.

Title: Good place to work. Very good cafeteria
Review Description: They were going to expand into LEDs and had a good strategy to use older equipment. But then they decided to buy a Fab in Japan and shut down LEDs. They did a good job of placing most of the people.

Title: Good place where you get enough time to spend with family.
Review Description: Good stable place to work. Company provides education if you take advantage of the opportunity. Have enough time off to take a vacation every year if you can afford it.

Title: Productive
Review Description: Good organization, but outsourcing more and more jobs. Great for those withing the engineering field. Still lots of potential in the R&D sector. Good benefits.
Pro: Environment
Con: Outsourcing

Title: Depending on the group a great place to work
Review Description: Depending on which group you hire with this is a good place to work with good co-workers. I have worked for good and bad managers it just depends on the area.

Title: Job security is poor
Review Description: The memory industry is a hard career field. The industry has had it's ups and downs that lead to many layoffs over the years. You are always afraid of layoff or now positions moving over seas.

Title: Great Place To Work
Review Description: Love Micron. Was one of the best places I ever worked. If the IM Flash location was somewhere else other than Utah, I'd still be working there today. Great people. Great leadership. If you can stand to live in Utah, you need to work at IM Flash (Micron).

Title: micron
Review Description: Pretty decent place, good pay, nice learning environment, decent hours, and the cafeteria was awesome. Pretty good coworkers and a good place to work.

Title: Fast paced, on your feet, limited breaks
Review Description: Strenuous, physically demanding work. You will be provided feedback on your performance. Advancement is extremely limited. Do not expect scheduled breaks. Lunchtime is scheduled 45 minutes and scattered for personnel so it can be as early as 10:00 AM or as late as 2:00.PM. Shifts are based on a 6 to 6 shift for shift workers (3-4 shifts a week) and 8 hr for non-shift workers (M-F).

Title: Productive and fun place to
Review Description: Global company that introduces cultures all over the globe. This always looking for way to improve the culture and way of life within the Micron environment.

Title: Fun, fast-paced environment!
Review Description: This is a great place to work if you love technology and enjoy being challenged. There is lots of room for growth and the training program is one of the best I have experienced.

Title: Avoid
Review Description:
Unless you are from the Boise area or just need a job I would not recommend micron. Definately do not leave a job and move to work at Micron.

The work culture in the area I worked is very old school. It is basically a dictatorship. Not open to new ideas. Everybody is afraid to make any noise at all since there are constant threats of being fired.

Title: Very much enjoyed working at Micron
Review Description: My days were busy with meetings and maintaining product and data throughput to various engineering, production, and supply groups. For the most part, I was able to make my own decisions and did not have anyone shadowing me. There were days that required long hours, however, they were flexible with personal time. I really enjoyed working with my coworkers, as well as counterparts in other departments.

Title: Politically managed, I was too honest
Review Description: Maintained Process gas quality very well. Supported entire company with online gas system monitoring. Maintained highest quality incoming gasses and components.

Title: A great place to work for those who fit within the culture.
Review Description:
A typical day is full of variety, fast-paced, and sometimes bound by tight deadlines and lean resources. People who fit with the culture don't mind working in this kind of environment.

Management quality varies a lot at Micron. In the last few years, the Company has focused on formal leadership development, and this is improving the quality and consistency of our leaders.

The hardest part of the job is also my favorite part of the job--figuring out how to produce high-quality results with lean resources and very aggressive deadlines.

The most important part of the job is developing and maintaining good working relationships with others, especially for those in global roles.

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: Great place to work, however there is concern regarding job security with current outsourcing of jobs. Micron offered education and training to empower growth of employees. I would work for Micron again if given the opportunity.

Title: educational experience, learned much!
Review Description: Coming in to work never knowing what was ahead of you was a great way to experience working here. Working with different departments was challenging. Work was always a process of thought and research. Each day was something new.

Title: It was okay but not great
Review Description: Compensation at Micron was good, but the days would be boring at times. It was my first internship and there also weren't many interns with me. Most of the employees were older so it was hard to relate to them.

Title: Micron is a large company, I have seen the best and worst of people here.
Review Description:
There are depts and managers at Micron that are successful and performing at high levels...then there is manufacturing which is comprised mostly of bad management that have been moved from one dept to another leaving a wake of failure behind them, yet continue to spread their bad moral and negative mindsets throughout the company. They remain because they are part of the "buddy system" This management has driven most of the good employees away from the Assembly mfg group. This entire Dept will officially be transferred to Taiwan in the Fall of 2018.

The outlook for micron in Boise is bleak and I believe all mfg at micron Boise will come to an end in the next few years. I would not recommend This company to anyone with ethics that wants a satisfying career with advancement.

Title: Production line
Review Description: I worked a twelve hour day 3 days a week then the next week was 4 days. It was a production job in a very clean environment due to the nature of the product being made.

Title: productive and fun workplace
Review Description:
a typical day at work = shift : 4days work 3 days off

management = undercontrol in strong supervise

the hardest part of the job : must achif the target on time with a good result..

Title: Great way to work more hads on.
Review Description: Great place to work, high tech with opportunity for advancement and professional development. Appreciated the opportunity to work in the Semi conductor business. Incredibly talented people I worked with in the trenches day in and day out - kept me going and motivated.

Title: No respect for employee skills
Review Description: Employer has no consideration for employees. They are much more interested in job titles than actual work done. They have no respect for those who hold degrees in science but are not "engineers." They instead pay them half for literally the exact same work. Incredibly arrogant and hierarchical. Will never work at this place for as long as I live.

Title: Love the people I worked with
Review Description: Incredibly talented and awesome people I worked with in the trenches day in and day out - kept me going and motivated. Very sterile environment otherwise. I was able to earn my MBA while there for which I am grateful.
Pro: Good training, excellent people
Con: Management

Title: Not very recomend
Review Description:
Routine work and not very good work and life balance
The management does not respect personal life as well
OT paid so the salary is quite okay
Benefits wise just bare minimum compared to other big firm

Title: Very fast paced.
Review Description: Great place to work, high tech with opportunity for advancement and professional development. Appreciated the opportunity to work in my specialty in the Semi conductor business, however, 4hour one way commute challenging to work life balance.

Title: Loved Micron
Review Description: Unfortunately I didn't get to experience must at Micron. They did a big layoff and being that I came right before they laid employees off I was one to go. I really don't have anything bad to say about Micron.

Title: Good Place To Work
Review Description:
It Good If Tou Like To Work Hands On
Lots of Different Machines To Work On Easy to Learn
Not Much Standing or Walking Around Unless You Have More Than One Machines

Title: Interim job
Review Description: Hard but satisfying work. Required specialized clothing that could be prohibitive. Would have considered maintaining employment if compensation would have been acceptable.

Title: Good Working Environment & Work/Life Balance
Review Description:
- Overall a good & dedicated team to work with.
- Shift work therefore good work/life balance.
- Always opportunities for promotion.
- Valuable knowledge gained during time at company.

Title: Supprt Technician
Review Description: Micron is a glorified sweatshop. You are not a name you are a number. I want to be part of a team, not part of the herd. I was promoted twice, however ended up working for someone I went to high school with, and we didn't get along. I moved on.

Title: Productive and very good place to work with b-ball court and ping-pong
Review Description: I was a contractor, but felt like part of the team. It did have good team work for the most part, and the people were positive and upbeat. Every company has its trials, but for the most part, employees rode the waves with grace. Good place to work.

Title: Very Fast paced and Competitive organisation
Review Description: My Typical Work day would start at 9.00 with a Stand up meeting with the Developement team. and next few ours for completing the assigned task and by the end of the day we have a daily review meeting with all the stake holder to assess where do we stand in that Sprint., this meeting especially helps us in achieving all our sprint goals in time. and also to come back to work with a very clear mind and understanding. though this meeting is not in Agile process , we tend to continue this.

Title: Large employer
Review Description: Micron used to be the largest employer in Idaho and is probably still a good firm to work for. There has been times of large layoffs and the company has sent a lot of manufacturing jobs overseas. That's just the way it goes.

Title: N/a
Review Description: is a fantastic organization to work for! Colleagues quickly become family and the culture makes you feel right at home! The work/life balance standard they have created with unlimited PTO is hard to find or even know of these days.

Title: Nice place to work
Review Description:
It depend on the day. it was really a fast pact moving company.
We was always on a dead line to get the wafers out the door.
I love the 4 days on 3 days off.

Title: Time Oriented place to work
Review Description: Some improvement over years, however culture is deep rooted into requiring employees to dedicate a large amount of time taking up space throughout the week rather than just saying if tasks are complete then no need to be present at site.

Title: Production Technician/ Production Operator
Review Description:
Responsibility :
• Day-to-day checking the stock such as gold wire, machine equipment and reporting if have any missing.
• Provide training to the newcomers.
• Co-ordinate with supervisor to check all the machine’s status and report to him frequently.
• Escalate/ email to the support engineer where the down-times activities cannot be resolved.
• Maintaining and Operating Machine, eg: Checking Machine daily performance & Temperature.
• Produces Solder Ball.
• Checking the product’s quality using by micro-scope.
• Adjustment the machine setting if have discrepancies.
Reason for leaving :
Seeking advanced prospects in IT Singapore.

Title: Very Good benefits
Review Description:
The Job was fast paced and you had to be able to think on the fly.
The micron management was very family oriented. All of the personnel were very easy to be around.

Title: No job security
Review Description: Doesn't matter if you been there for 30+ years, your just a number to upper management and could be cut to save the company a few cents. Good benefits and time off but never expect a raise.

Title: A good place to intern
Review Description: Micron is a good place to work as an intern. The company puts a lot of effort into matching interns with the best group for their skills and interests. Work is usually interesting and of importance, but they don't push the interns too hard. They also provide intern activities outside of work.

Title: Solid employer, some projects/managers better than others
Review Description: I work in IT and I happen to work on a project that is very demanding and there is a lot of pressure to meet deadlines. I don't see this as typical, but it is not uncommon either. As a contract worker, I get paid overtime, which is fine, but I see a lot of colleagues who work very long hours on this project and they are salaried and I ask myself, why would they do it?

Title: Good Place To Work
Review Description:
I have enjoyed my time working for Micron. I have learned a lot and gained a variety of experience.

You need excellent computer skills
they have awesome benefits with a medical facility on site
The parking is not ideal you have to walk a long way.

Title: Stressful and fast paced workplace, however people around make the work enjoyable
Review Description:
Positives
1) Great collaboration between inter department teams
2) Great employee benefits such as medical, AWS and performance bonus
3) Allows employee to internal jump between departments after a period of employment

Negative
1) Fast Pace and stressful
2) Lots of documentations needed to make a change
3) 24/7 Operational
Pro: Good collaboration between teams, Good employee benefits, allows employee to internal jump between departments
Con: 24/7 operational, KPI Driven, lots of documentations needed to make a change

Title: Micron Material Handler
Review Description: Excellent work opportunity with benefits. Different shift schedules to fit any personal situation or needs. Working in a team environment is highly encouraged. Required to work with others internally and externally whether face-to-face, by telephone, email, or instant message. Attention to detail is a must whether taking requisition orders or maintaining inventory accuracy.
Pro: Shift work schedules, 401K, Time Off Program
Con: Physical labor and long hours on your feet

Title: Fast-paced, data driven.
Review Description: Micron is a fast paced, data driven work environment with a solid management team and smart employees that work hard and drive to deliver compelling, high-quality products on time and within budget.

Title: A typical semiconductor company
Review Description: Great co-workers and supervisor. Workplace culture was fairly typical for semi-conductor company. Most enjoyable part of the job was the co-workers and the actual work. The work was constantly evolving with each process node which kept the work interesting.

Title: Micron was a very sturdy place to work.
Review Description:
I was in a very fast paced logistical position monitoring the production line and making sure the priority product was processed in a timely manor.
I was required to make decisions regularly to obtain the above goals and report to management.

Title: Long term employment great benefits
Review Description: I worked at Micron for 28 years. Worked as an operator for 5 years in Diffusion than into a trainer position for 5 years in Diffusion. Moved to Dry Etch for 3 years. Transfered to Fab 4 in Photo. I worked Overtime in Wet Etch. Promoted to Manufacturing Technician in Wet Etch. Moved over to the New Led to get it started. After its closure moved over to Assembly. It was a great opportunity to learn alot of machines areas and training employees for so many years.

Title: Stressful, watch your back kind of environment
Review Description: Wouldn't do it again if the begged and offered 200K. Code base was a joke. Management was a joke. Felt like a prisoner. What else can I say. Small cramped cubicles for engineers. Incompetent non-technical managers. No clear communication of company direction. I worked in the SDD development group.

Title: Mind blowing experience
Review Description: From the day I walked in till even now 1 year later this is the most exciting job I've had. Every day is a learning experience with the technology that it takes to make the product.

Title: never again
Review Description:
I have been working at Micron Technology full-time (More than 10 years)

Pros

Pay, benefits, time-off program are all good for the area. Good people that really want the company to succeed. Corporate seems to want people to be happy, areas do not have the same beliefs and never apply the same practices.

Cons

Good ol' boys network trenched into middle management positions so either suck up to them or go nowhere. A do more with less mentality stacked with a results first, people second approach makes for poor morale which inhibits this company.

Advice to Management

More anonymous peer to peer reviews of management to clean out the roadblocks that stifle the true creativity of the people in this company. The good ol' boys protect each other and do not care about the people that work for them. For this to be a good company to work for this must be addressed.

Title: laid off after 15 years
Review Description: worked my butt off, and they laid me off for an outsourcer in India. stupid. They brought the jobs back after 2 years, but did not hire anyone back. started over with newbies and small salaries.

Title: Great place to work.
Review Description: I had intended on retiring at Micron but the higher ups had another idea. I really loved my job. I don't understand how a lot of our jobs here are going overseas. That is BS.

Title: Productive and Fun working place
Review Description:
Enjoyed working in Micron Technology.
Din't find any typical day there.
Friendly working culture
Leaving Micon is the hardest part.
every moment enjoyed working there

Title: Ho Hum place
Review Description: Laid back work culture. Limited opportunity to advance. Preference given to long time Micron employees for promotions. No generous in giving stock options and the Bonus plan is average.

Title: Excellent Company
Review Description: All personnel were team players, and a big family. Micron always looked upon the employee needs, excellent procedure system and training. The company had open door policy to all managers and supervisor.

Title: A good MNC company with good starting pay
Review Description:
A good MNC company with good starting pay, but please be prepared to take tons of OT.
A typical engineering job role, need to take care petty work every day
No much sense of accomplishment, but endless minor minor things
Friendly working environment
Good for you if you are a engineering person

Title: I loved it
Review Description: I genuinely liked going to work. It was filled with many intelligent and hard working people from all corners of the earth. I enjoyed it and I would do it again.

Title: Very diversed automated equipment.
Review Description: Very diversed automated equipment in top of the line automated test equipment for IC handling equipment and tester equipment on the test floor . Very challenging in the beginning to be able to work on so many different types of automated equipment.

Title: Good place for starters
Review Description: Management needs improvement. Good health insurance and paid time off. They could do better on their salary as other companies in the same industry pay more

Title: learning & growing work place
Review Description:
• learning place
• coordinate with different department / people
• manage cycle count / inventory
• on time delivery
• ensure daily shipments process to meet customer requirement

Title: Great pay, long hours
Review Description: Benefits and pay make the hours manageable. 3 on 4 off gave plenty of time off during a work week. Are required to work holidays. 401k is excellent. Good place to work

Title: It is a very stressful place to work
Review Description: This job was very very stressful despite the well laid out buildings with great facilities. This place is well structured with great benefits. It was easy to get lost in the huge buildings.

Review Description: THe company culture is good and don't want to leave if the pay was good, and when asking for raise there is more work load that an employee needs to improve to get the raise , other than that company is really good place to work.
Pro: All employee respect each other
Con: pay

Title: Productive
Review Description: NIce place to work as of work culture. Enjoyed working in the company. It is better to improve on pay schemes and work life balance aspect. Enjoyed the working
Pro: Overtime Pay
Con: Work during off days

Title: Great Company to work for
Review Description: Management is flexable, people are down to earth, tech is a little old style but does a great job. Hardest part is coordinating with so many spread out groups.

Title: fast paced place to work
Review Description:
lots of opportunities to advance and move around the company. great pay and benefits.

fast paced work environment that can be challenging working with others who are less efficient.

Title: Has its perks
Review Description: You get to be on the edge of technology. Unfortunately that comes with having your job be subject to the next market adjustment. It has its perks and its pull backs but is overall a great organization.

Title: A decent company to work for.
Review Description: A decent company to work with decent benefits. Would be great if the company is more generous with stock options and offer ESPP program like most other companies.

Title: It was a nice place to work with
Review Description: It really a nice place to work with. The environment is friendly and collaborative. Managers were appreciate what you have done. We worked as a whole team and helped each other

Title: Not good
Review Description: Long hours and rotating shifts that switched from days to nights monthly. Management cared more about product output than employee well being. Work atmosphere was subdued with little humor or interaction.

Title: stressful and poor management
Review Description:
Swing shift with 12 hour shifts take a toll on the body and mind. Shifts rotated days to nights every month so you could never adjust to a sleep schedule.
Management cared about product output more that the employees.

Title: Productive
Review Description: Micron is an american company, a very good one, treat foreign workers equally, give full benefits, bonuses etc., Concern in safety & health of each of everyone.

Title: Good co workers and co worker support
Review Description: Have learned a lot about a new system Ariba, have spent a lot of time on the errors that is caused and solutions on how to fix. trained Suppliers on a lot of the system.

Title: Great Place to Work
Review Description: The corporate office in Boise Idaho is where I worked. I was in the production fabs. Long shifts but we got 3-4 days off in a row. Benefits were great. Stock options and profit sharing.

Title: Relaxed and very good work environment
Review Description: Very good place to work and had very good work life balance. The team is very encouraging and always help us to achieve our goals. The engineering team is very good.

Title: Working at micron was awful.
Review Description: Working at micron was stressful. They were alway on us about not making rate when it wasn’t our fault. They would never get enough people in there to work to make it easier on any of us.

Title: N/a
Review Description: Not the right person to review as it was only a part-time job for me. No OT pay for fulltimers. Good pay for part timers and understanding and supportive management.

Title: Good Place to work
Review Description: MIcron provided my family good stability while helping us to maintain a good work/life balance. The benefits were good, my only issue is with the volatility of the semiconductor industry. The 6 years that I worked there. I saw 4 lay offs and the most recent pushed me out due to moving 4 entire department over to Taiwan.

Title: Great environment for the self motivated to show abilities to get required jobs done .
Review Description: Micron is a great environment for the self motivated to show abilities to get required jobs done A place to enhance your abilities and provide what is needed in a fast paced, every more demanding environment.
Job Title: RDL Module Owner/Tool Owner, Fab 17 RDL

Title: Great Place
Review Description: Working at Micron was a blast. I had very good management. There is a food court where you can order breakfast and lunch. The menu is very impressive.

Title: good place to work
Review Description: SSD drive development is difficult so make sure that is what you want for your career. Good managers, good location. Much of the initial development is done at other sites.

Title: Productive and challenging work enviroment
Review Description: Micron will challenge you on a daily basis. The high paced manufacturing and qualification of new products is very important. The management will push you to create goals and set you up for success. The hardest part of the job is adapting to the ever changing environment and product line. What I enjoy most is the flexibility in work hours and the people you get to work with.
