Title: I would never go back to that company again
Review Description: Micron was a good place to work in the beginning.Once I was there for about 3-4 years, I had found out first hand what the company was all about.The management and the line leaders would talk down to their employee and belittle them. The morale there was low. You would not get the recognition for doing a good job.
Pro: Friendly co-workers
Con: the management

Title: Good Place to Work
Review Description: Fast Pace environment. Performing Pm's, Working on unscheduled downs.Working with vendors, Equipment managers, equipment owners and Process owners, Ordering parts and updating equipment manuals.

Title: Loved my job. Productive and I learned a lot. I thought I would retire there.
Review Description: I loved my job at Micron. I learned a lot but there was a lot for me still to learn. I was very upset and still am over being laid off. I feel the Management above my Supervisor did not connect with or really care about the employees. I have been laid off since October 2017. I am still looking for a career. I am scared that I wont find one. Thank You

Title: As previous employee
Review Description: Depreciative leadership and management, stressful work load, low pay scale, connections needed for promotion and racial preferences. Lowest job security enviroment.

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: Working at Micron full time position over 13 years with great people, received best health insurance plan, flexible time off program, good carrier opportunity.

Title: Good
Review Description: Steady paycheck. Good discounts. Good people. Company lacked a definitive way forward. New CEO seems like he is on the right track. Hopefully, they can male the leap.

Title: Relaxing work enviornment.
Review Description: The company is alright to work for but there is zero reliability. There will be layoff every 18 to 24 months and sometimes for no reason. The company does not reward based on work or productivity but is driven solely by college degree. Don't start unless you have a BA, don't plan on advancing unless you have masters or better.

Title: Micron Intern
Review Description: The best internship I ever had. Had my housing almost completely paid for the summer because I live outside the area. Lots of intern events and meetings with senior level mangers and directors. Great company culture. Learned a lot. Very competitive intern hourly pay.

Title: Decent company but can be stressful.
Review Description: Quite a bit of "politics" there. If you were not close with someone up high, your chances of getting a better job position definitely decreases. Benefits and pay were good though.

Title: Fun place while i was there but....
Review Description: when layoffs started the best people started abandoning ship. Inside sources would let you know when another round was coming. The well balanced teams were destroyed. Now they are struggling everywhere.

Title: Manufacturing Technician
Review Description:
Monitor tool performance, preventative maintenance on assigned tool sets
Communicating with Lead Tech and/or Lead Engineer on tool and area issues
Troubleshooting, problem solving, tracking and reviewing to increase tool uptime

Title: Great cutting edge company
Review Description:
Great place to work.
Collaborate with a talented team of cross-discipline engineers and production.
Goal oriented.
Innovation is encouraged and rewarded.
Constant cost cutting and quality improvements.
Cutting edge: new parts are introduced every few months.

Title: Hectic and reactive
Review Description: Layoffs poorly planned and rehires months and even weeks down the road. Repeated efforts of culture shift but someone needs to tell the mid-managers. Little to no accountability for behavior or poor decisions.

Title: Micron WAS a great place to work in Boise
Review Description: Great Company until it got too big. Upper VP's are eliminating jobs in the U.S. Doubt the Boise site will be here in 5 yrs. Jobs will go overseas and IP will no longer be secured.

Title: Good company to work for
Review Description: Good company to work for with the exception of rotating 12 hour shifts. When working 7pm to 7am you don't have much of a life. Immediate management was good.

Title: Good work environment
Review Description:
Overall good company to work for.
Many resources to learn new skills.
The job can change drastically between weeks, so it keeps you looking forward all the time; always keep improving.

Title: Terrible
Review Description: Micron was an absolutely terrible company to work for due to the biased management. There was extreme favoritism and it was to an a ridiculous amount.

Title: Fun place and high learning
Review Description: I joined Micron as a data science intern and it was really great learning adventure for me. People are helpful, my team was superb and there was loads of fun also.

Pro: great benefit
Con: highly stressful

Title: A good place to work, great benefits and pay at the time.
Review Description:
I tested memory modules on various motherboards for compatibility. Some trouble-shooting of motherboards, data collection. As a night shift worker, a lot of autonomy.
It was difficult to stay motivated if there was not a lot to do. Other times, it was being constantly in motion.
Pro: Consistent hours, good pay/benefits
Con: Boring at times, super busy at others.

Title: Worst place to work
Review Description:
This is the worst company to land in with a job.
There is no career advancement.
No work life balance.
Management is clueless man hour requirements.
Exploitation in the name of over time pay and firing is rampant
No training is provided
Although company makes money, employees get nothing.
Lot of favoritism in this place.

Title: different people and with different culture
Review Description:
It is my first Job here in US and learned the new working culture.
12 working hours a day
And also different working environment which i haven't been.
Lots of people from almost all of the parts of the world

Title: Fun place to work.
Review Description: Very relaxed working environment with a very diverse work force. Long 12 hour shift with only 2-3 breaks per shift. Basically just standing in one spot for 12 hours at a time. Good pay and benefits. Mediocre management.

Title: Mixed Reviews
Review Description: There was little room for advancement. The benefits were good. The hours were good while you were on day shift, but night shift hours tend to destroy your personal life. Non-transparent upper management... You are likely to get outsourced or lose your job for no reason at any moment.

Title: Fun workplace
Review Description: Worked on the Administering Tableau Server as well as created dashboards related to Tableau Admin views. Good place. Work life balance is not that great.

Title: Good place to work, but stressful
Review Description: Micron worked with me while my mom was sick and needed time off. I will be forever grateful for the understanding of my department and managers. The benefits and pay were good

Title: Excellent company
Review Description: Excellent company good people, the administration provide training for new equipment, all time with new equipment for best production. The administration is good, the main matrix in idaho provide good salary.

Title: Toxic Work Environment
Review Description: As a maintenance technician the work is non-stop. Often have to skip breaks. Little to no career advancement. Micron does NOT give annual raises. There was a lot of conflicts between shifts. There were a few good managers, but most of them were only focus on their careers and the appearance of a well run team.

Title: Competitive and Volatile Industry
Review Description:
Memory Semiconductors is a very competitive and volatile industry. Be prepared for periods of feast or famine. Sometimes it's "all hands on deck". Other times you'll struggle to look productive.

There are many opportunities for those willing to work hard and learn.

Title: Great Team to Work with until 2009
Review Description: I started working at Micron in 2004 to the major lay-off of it's workforce in 2009. The teams I worked with for the first five years I was there was really something. I felt that I belonged and that most everyone worked as a team. I was able to advance and there was a sense of accomplishment on the classes and advancements I received. Even during this time lay-offs always seemed to appear at least every year or two and that part of the job was stressful. I resumed working for Micron's Joint venture Transform Solar in 2011 then transferred to Fab 4 (R&D) once Transform Solar went under. Micron helped me get my degree and had good benefits but the prior team work wasn't there like it used to be. I felt unfulfilled and unchallenged as a Manufacturing Tech at Micron. Nothhing against the company but I wanted to venture out and co start a business with an associate in the travel industry.

Title: Excellent Experience
Review Description: Micron provided an excellent professional environment for development. The job is constantly asking you to apply a complex set of skills and help the engineering team work to build new products. The management is incredibly understanding and always encouraging involvement in projects. The team is supportive and the work experience is something I will always recommend.

Title: Rest in peace.
Review Description: The part of Micron that I worked for was sold off and 90% of the staff let go. The microdisplay technology developed in Longmont was interesting but never found a large market.

Title: Friendly-great benefits
Review Description: Friendly atmosphere with long days but short weeks (3 to 4 day weekends). Management is fair and friendly. Awsome benefits. Good ballance between personal and work life.

Title: Productive place to work with great community outreach
Review Description: I really enjoy the work environment. There are a great many people that I enjoy working with, including management, co-workers, production personnel, and cross functional teams. The benefits are awesome and the community outreach is the best in the Treasure Valley.

Title: Great place to begin a career
Review Description: Could not have asked for a better entry-level work experience. I received hands-on experience each and every day and after my full-time summer internship was able to continue working part-time throughout the school year. What a great opportunity!

Title: Decent
Review Description: This place is not bad but I did not enjoy my time here spent. I did not like the environment and the people were too much drama. I think someone needs to take charge soon.

Title: Avoid this place
Review Description: Place was cut throat, people would set each other up to get fired in order to get their job or to try to avoid being laid off. Makes me laugh thinking of someone so desperate to make a dollar more an hour that they try to set someone else to get fired. Its a buddy culture, unless your the right persons buddy at that place you will never get promoted.

Title: Productive and a very intellectual community to work at.
Review Description: It was a very cool opportunity to be able to work at micron, especially being only 19 years old. The management was very friendly and my favorite part about working there was the amount of options they had for lunch everyday!

Title: Great support and hospitality.
Review Description:
Great support and hospitality. Great working environment. Good health benefits and work compensation. More job advancement and
career opportunity. Micron is like home away from home.

Title: Productive team with a nice gym
Review Description: Supportive team collaborating for a common goal. The gym provided a healthy option during breaks and lunch. Reasonable job requirements in a casual work environment.

Title: Good environment working place.
Review Description: Good place to grow your Semiconductor knowledge , opportunity to upgrade your skills. Gym facility available. Team building. IPP incentives if meet every 6 months.

Title: Good
Review Description: Nice company to work in.I had a great experience.good culture and good company and its clients and Business users.excellent learning by knowing new things
Job Title: Team Lead Consultant for SAP APO

Title: Productive
Review Description: Fun place to work fun. Learned a lot while working because we get to communicate with Engineers. Always willing to teach us even more if we desired. Micron was the best place for me for work for. I just had to leave because I got lay off.

Title: Micron is a competitive, fast-paced technology company
Review Description:
I enjoyed working at Micron because no two days were the same! I never knew what I would need to do each day and I looked forward to learning something new about the equipment I worked on each day.

My coworkers were awesome, management was OK. The atmosphere at this company is cut-throat. You are reminded you are replaceable. This is OK when you know your job is hard to fill.

I left to have children and my husband still works there. He loves the continual learning and the constant challenge of new technology.

Title: Quick-Paced, Challenging Work
Review Description: This environment was high energy and very quick-paced due to the demands of creating wafers (computer chips). The work was 24 hours/day, so you needed to always be ready to act.

Title: great place to work, if you can get in a good area.
Review Description: It is an extremely great and fun place to work if you can get into a safe area to work. Layoffs are a common thing and so you need to keep that in mind.

Title: Is a good company
Review Description: good company. All different countries of people working here. Good benefit. Very good environment. Different cultures people working here. priorities on safety .

Title: Micron was a great place to work
Review Description: Thoroughly enjoyed working at Micron Technology. There were demands on the workforce that were expected to be met. I have nothing negative to say about Micron.

Title: Micron
Review Description: I started in the internship program and was brought in after nine months, once my degree was complete. The internship opportunity was a much needed start to my career in Electronics Engineering Technology. When working in a fast paced manufacturing environment, you learn the importance of efficient troubleshooting and collaborative skills.

Title: fast paced environment
Review Description:
12 hr production shifts with job duties that are constantly changing
due to the nature of the business,contantly learning new processes or a new area.

Title: Micron Technology
Review Description: I didn't intend to leave the company but the job sadly has moved to Taiwan. Working for Micron was great. There is plenty of places to work and advance to.

Title: Highly competitive industry with lot of opportunities to improve the growth of the career
Review Description: Micron Technology is a high tech company which provide opportunity to explore and improve the career and gives equal opportunity to all employees. Micron give priority to the people and value them as the most important assess of the company.

Title: Great business.
Review Description: Great benefits and a good working environment. Allot of us are wishing that some manufacturing would stay in Boise, Idaho, as it is where the company was founded.

Title: Good company
Review Description:
Work culture and benefits are good
Working time flexibility
more training classes
health care benefits
Cafeteria facility good
learned trust,commitment and quality

Title: Commodity products, commodity culture
Review Description:
The overriding theme at Micron is cheaper.

No matter how ill-advised a choice was, if it was cheaper in the short-term than the alternatives that would be the path.

They also had no hesitation to cut costs by hiring freezes, salary freezes, promotion freezes and layoffs.

I never saw Micron lay out a dime for training.

Don't anticipate fast promotion or raises if the salary offer you receive is low.

Title: Good company, perpetually understaffed
Review Description:
A solid company, with established guidelines, excellent compensation (both monetary and otherwise) and clear expectations about workload.

Title: You will become a zombe over time!
Review Description:
Nothing has been the same since Steve has been gone and the management is now horrible with the attitude that you are lucky to have a job and they have no clue about what is going on in the manufacturing areas.

96% of the production occurs in Asia, overseas training occurs during the night so you are expected to work your normal day hours and then be on call all night long. My typical work day is 6:00am till 6:00pm and then once you are home remote logging in until midnight or later at locations all over the world. Scheduled vacation time is not really vacation at all as you are asked to still login from wherever you are and keep machines running.

Expect long nights, no life, unrealistic deadlines, and all the managers taking credit for your hard work and long hours.

If you do something good then management is always there to take the credit for it. Be prepared for them to ask you to do things unethical and if something negative comes out of it they will play as they know nothing about it.

Micron used to be the best place in the world to work. Now it has gotten so big that you are now a number. Stock options are gone, bonuses are very small, and everyone has a very negative outlook about everything now days.

There are some good departments at Micron to work for, so if you are going to apply for a job at this company do your homework and find the good departments or else do not waste your time here. There is a reason Micron cannot recruit the top Engineers out of school as they used to 10~ ago...

Pro: Lots of breaks, Great pay, Good coworkers, Easy work
Con: Long shifts

Title: The work/life balance at Micron and benefits are great.
Review Description:
The work/life balance at Micron and benefits are great. But if you're not in one of the main office branches, you can't expect any personal development or growth opportunities.

Additionally, there is blatant favoritism amongst managers/Directors, and the office culture is starting to resemble high school as opposed to a professional working environment.

If you're interested in switching departments, or further developing the role you begin in, this is likely not the place for you.

Title: Fast pace, learning enviroment
Review Description:
Great place to learn
Very advance technology
Diverse culture
Salaries are good
Global company
Actual make products
Great people
Good internal job posting system

Title: Nice place to work
Review Description:
This is nice place to work with our co-workers under development.
Management need to be improved and worked together like a team.
I had a lot of memory to work for this company. This is nice place to work.

Title: Innovative
Review Description: Fun to be a part of it. Wehas a very productive environment with very good coordination. All the team are well known about there task and and happy to accept the mistakes when occured.

Title: Great company with lots of room for growth
Review Description: Micron Technology Inc is extremely supportive of transferring between departments. The benefits provided are excellent, compensation is competitive. Projects are the majority of each day. Instead of tasks to accomplish, the workload is delivered as problems to solve.

Title: like the job, don't like the hrs
Review Description: i load an test memory chips, i work 12hrs a day, the company has poor communication, hardest part of job is loading ovens, i work with good people

Title: Feedback
Review Description: I have lot technically in Micron and tried to be independent without approaching seniors for help.The team is very helpfull at tough situations. It is a great experience working in Micron

Title: An excellent place to work if you can handle corporate policies.
Review Description: 12 hours shifts make for a long day but a great weekend with 3 to 4 days off. I learned much about both the industrialized world, and corporate America. However, management can get involved with processes that tend to interfere with the bottom line: doing the best you can at your job, while striving to make profit for the company in the most efficient manner possible. The workplace culture is great, very team oriented and friendly. I still have friends from Micron, and that was almost ten years ago. The hardest part of the job was the hours and some of the positions had grueling physical demands. My favorite part of the job was the fact that there was always something to learn - all you have to do is ask.

Title: Okay..
Review Description: Okay place to work at. Wants people to do more with less. More work keeps adding even though they say do essential work only.

Title: Wants loyalty from employee but none from employer
Review Description:
After giving 18 years to the company I was laid off mostly because I was a non degreed (BS) engineer. Performing the same job functions as the degreed engineers for over 10 years. My job was recently posted for a degreed engineer.
They talk of the "Micron Culture" but there true culture is to keep non US employees (green card, visa holders) employed for tax breaks but let the real American worker go.... Trump should follow up on this!! If major American employers have layoffs then non American workers must be the ones to be laid off instead of 100% American citizens!!
Job Title: CHANGE CONTROL ENGINEER / PROCESS CONTROL ENGINEER

Title: Challenging and rewarding work
Review Description: The team environment is rewarding and fun. The work is challenging and cutting edge, as long you are part of the better engineering departments.

Title: Great enviroment fun people to work with
Review Description: Micron is a great company, world wide opportunities. The people are friendly for the most part. At times the work load is more then desirable however it keeps one busy

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: Excellent opportunities to advance. Company provides excellent training and is willing to compensate for school. Stable and fulfilling work environment.

Title: Good place to learn
Review Description: Excellent work and life balance. Get to learn lot of technical skills. . Good lab and infrastructure. Clearly defined goals and good support from management.

Title: Shaky on gaurunteed work but good place otherwise .
Review Description: I enjoyed working at micron. I wasn't making enough money at all and my hours were so shaky. I enjoyed wielding and the peers around me were very fun to work with.

Title: Work with the productions of microchips
Review Description: Able to assist internal and external customers. Assisted in the production of microchips. Worked in a diverse environment at different hours of the day and year.

Title: Productive day on Hot Motherboard Test
Review Description:
A typical day at work was twelve hours of production
I learned to do production goals
The workplace culture is working very hard with minimum supervision

Title: Great culture and decent salary
Review Description: There's no politics in Micron and most of colleagues are friendly. It is well managed and cares about every team member's feeling. But similar to other semiconductor companies, the workload is heavy to some degree.

Title: Stressful and fast paced workplace, however people around make the work enjoyable
Review Description:
Positives
1) Great collaboration between inter department teams
2) Great employee benefits such as medical, AWS and performance bonus
3) Allows employee to internal jump between departments after a period of employment

Negative
1) Fast Pace and stressful
2) Lots of documentations needed to make a change
3) 24/7 Operational
Pro: Good collaboration between teams, Good employee benefits, allows employee to internal jump between departments
Con: 24/7 operational, KPI Driven, lots of documentations needed to make a change

Title: Its a great place to work.
Review Description:
I start work at 8 am and finish at 5:15pm. My typical work day start with careful planning of my tasks for that particular day. Most of the time I would plan about 4 to 5 tasks per day and almost everyday I am able to accomplish them.

I've learnt a great deal in my last 7 years here. Particularly the management of the inventory. The work culture in Micron is fun and the work life balance is finely aligned.

The hardest part of the work is dealing with subordinates with bad attitude, thankfully now I've learnt to overcome this issues fairly well.

The most enjoyable part of my work is when an idea of mine take shape and works well for the organization. An example, I successfully managed to redesign a test fixture that came to Singapore from Boise, USA. As a result we were able to save a huge amount of money from operational cost.
Pro: Near my residence
Con: Prefer a personal work chamber but never to be.

Title: Productive and Great platform
Review Description: It's a great platform to work, learn, grow up with great job security. Great work life balance and excellent environment to prove abilities as team.

Title: It was a very condusive environment to work in as it was more professional and family like.
Review Description: Micron to me was a very nice place to work. It was a professional environment where everyone knows what is expected of him/her. It was a place where there was so much emphasis on safety and security due to the nature of what they do.

Title: Working in the warehouse
Review Description: My days start with looking what days(morning shifts) has left me to do and finishing it up,(night shifts) going through my emails and seeing if days miss anythings. i have learned at lot of new skills like driving the forklift, understanding how to be a material handler and knowing how to use the system/programs they use.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: Test DRAM for products of different types for daily use constantly moving people friendly make long lasting relationships knowing that at the end of the day you did a good job and feel satisfied.

Title: Challenging and Dynamic
Review Description: Dynamic and challenging work environment, good place for learning and skills development. It was positive to be part of global company and gain wider cultural perspective.

Title: Great place to work. Good work/life balance
Review Description: The basic functions in the company are done exceedingly well. The more important parts of the company like forecasting need some improvement. It is getting better.

Title: Good
Review Description:
Pros
Like time off policy, great people, good productivity culture
Cons
Get the feeling we are lagging behind competition

Title: lot of fun people around
Review Description: testing product constantly under stressful condition to make sure it will perform up to standards. running testing equipment all the time

Title: Nice environment
Review Description: Great place to further your education. Depends on your education 24/7 operation. Long shift, great people to work with!

Title: Productive and fun work
Review Description: I've had in my career of about 2 years in Micron. The company cares about its employees and goes above and beyond to create a positive work environment. Lots of room for advancement and growth within The only reason I leave micron is to give birth baby in Myanmar and take care baby.

Title: Long Term Employment?
Review Description: Worked their 30 years, until replaced by temporary employess with no benefits. Right after recieving my 30 year service award. They are a profit motivated group. Good luck to them.

Title: Good experience
Review Description:
Good company to work for
Located in Boise Idaho
It matters that you are at headquarter as apposed to outside city
Micron is located all over the world

Title: Productive and enjoying
Review Description:
Good indeed good benefits and more enjoyable place have a good team work.nice environment .have a good salary and transport for go and back.
Good leadership

Title: No Career growth
Review Description: No career growth at all. The managers give false hopes on giving more exposure in different areas. But none fulfilled. Too much favoritism in the team. And less basic salary

Title: would not recomment to a friend
Review Description: Very top heavy. Can not make decisions at the top. Industry is very up and down. They cut people when it's down, then refill the same position 5 month later.

Title: Demanding work Environment
Review Description: The semiconductor business is a highly competitive due to the tremendous requirements for quality while keeping productivity as efficient as possible. Tremendous competition from global companies forces the to apply constant improvement pressures on the employees and production equipment. Due to these factors it is a high stress business which can be rewarding to those who are willing to make the sacrifice of time and leisure.

Title: Remain proactive
Review Description: It's a great place to work. Great benefit. But its a competitive industry so you have to be pro-active. Work shift are 12 hours if you are working in the fabrication floor. You also have to wear full body smock to work on the floor.

Title: Big MNC - little worklife balance
Review Description: High turnover, benefits are little. work is never ending, management are trying to survive themselves. Nice environment though. steep learning curve for new hires

Title: A great place to go to work.
Review Description:
The best place to work at in the Treasure Valley.
Technically oriented and numbers and quality of product driven manufacturing company. I learned manufacturing jargon and regulations. It was hard to keep up with some required deadlines to push product out. With that said their was a lot of support from management to improve. I am extremely grateful.

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: Difficult and stressful but overall well run company. Company is growing quite rapidly and so there is a lot of change going on. There has been a tendency to build bureaucratic systems that do not seem well served.
Pro: Pay
Con: Difficult working environment a great deal of the time

Title: poor work life balance
Review Description:
- direct supervisors are ridiculous
- gives ridiculous remarks
- does not motivate employees
- does not have opportunity for overseas training
- unable to rate employees effectively(communist style, everyone gets the same rating.)

Title: busy, fast paced
Review Description: I learned how to operate many different types of testers. I worked closely with Engineers. I was very versatile in many areas within the company. I was always busy, and lending a helping hand, when needed

Title: great co workers
Review Description: Loved working here. Unfortunately it was working there during a downturn in the economy and was let go along with thousands of other employees.

Title: Fun workplace
Review Description: i learnt a lot in Micron. I joined micron right after I graduated from university. My colleges there are helpful and I made friend with them there. My daily job is mainly to maintain the product quality during production. Hard part of the job is that when there are a lot of things on hand, I will need to allocate my time and settle them with very short of time as in semicon industry the manufacturing speed is very fast. If a problem cannot be resolved asap, then it will be huge loss to the company. The most enjoyable part of the job is that the working environment is very easy going, people there are really quite nice to me.

Title: Great place to work if job security is improved.
Review Description:
Great place to work.
Friendly people at the Folsom site.

There is so much uncertainty/job insecurity due to volatility in the market and rumors that company will be taken over or sold. The site being not a manufacturing site also adds to the uncertainty.

Title: Good place to improve your knowledge
Review Description: There is a lot of technology and job skills that you can learn. The management is not so strict. The most difficult thing is to deal with a co-worker who does not to put in a fair share of work load.

Title: productive and challenging
Review Description: Working as an Engineer in Micron typically would be quite stressful and challenging. Most of the time the job would require doing frequent overtime which may suggest that the work life balance is very difficult to maintain

Title: Level 2 Support work, paid like a Level 1
Review Description: Constantly bombarded with email, phone and chat without the sufficient amount of people to delegate the tasks to. We all tried our best to keep up with the influx of incidents that would come in but it was clear that they were not interested in boosting company morale, or pay. They did not pay us for the level 2 work we provided. We were paid level 1 or even below.

Title: Some parts and areas work very well
Review Description: Micron is learning how to be a big company. Improving efforts to align and get everyone on the same page. Recent focus has been on execution on previous R&D Efforts.

Title: Company first mindset
Review Description: Benefits are attractive. Compensation is more than adequate. Shift schedule should in theory allow for 4 days off every other week but mandatory overtime was required very regularly. Often given the impression that employees were a burden to management not an asset. Employees are literally reduced to a number.

Title: Excellent place to work with talented people
Review Description: Micron is a very good place with talented people. The management is very open to change and constantly to improve the work environments for its employees. Co-workers balance the need to get the job done with a sense of comradery.

Title: Micron is a great place to work. Work life balance can be tough but up to you and progression is also driven more by you than anyone else.
Review Description: Still a great company in the valley and likely unmatched wrt salary ranges in Boise. Success is less driven by the corporate development efforts and more left to individual drive...if you are driven, you can succeed. Very department specific wrt leadership style and culture....many acquisitions, long time managers and lack of corporate discipline here create the variance...that said, everything is what you make of it.

Title: Bad and arrogant management, though not the worst
Review Description: Cannot learn any good skills but repetitive work. Managers all appear superior but in fact just talkative. No any RnD. If some claimed they do, then be alerted on them as their faces will change very often and their mouths change also quickly. No class.

Title: Workplace environment
Review Description: Upper management is great to work with and they understand the difficulties and complexities that procurement endures on a day to day basis. My co-workers are great and help support me in any way possible. The most enjoyable part of the job is meeting people from all over the world. I believe we have people from over 35 different countries.

Title: The individual contributors are amazing to work with
Review Description:
The talent within this organization is top notch. Most of the interaction are positive and there is plenty of help to go around should you run into roadblocks.

The management seems to be misdirected often enough to make it difficult to feel secure. In the 2 years I was there we were re-directed to 6 different projects. None of them completed.

Title: Management was engaged in the development of their employees
Review Description: The position was never repetitive and allowed me to work on many different projects at the same time. My direct supervisor did not micro-mange my time which gave me the freedom to utilize my resources and research the issues at hand. The hardest part of the job was organizing meetings between department managers to agree upon process changes. The most enjoyable part of the job was doing the research to find solutions on how to improve process while keeping high quality and low cost.

Title: Join this place if you have no other options
Review Description:
Incompetent management and no work life balance of employees.

The company banks on overtime pay out to employees and expects them to work 24*7. Your boss will ask you about work over a Watsapp message at 2am, dont be surprised.

very unprofessional approach to work and employee privacy or personal spaces are always undermined.

Title: great environment for innovation
Review Description: Led marketing worldwide for Microns channels and branded products business. Great management, sales and marketing experience scaling past $1bn global revenues. Opening new channels and markets in all regions, developping new lines of business from retail, etail to VAR and enterprise channels

Title: Productive and Fast Paced
Review Description: Learned about designing and testing ASIC's for memory subsystems. Co-workers are awesome. The most enjoyable part of the job was the many different projects you got to work on.

Review Description:
Felt like just ordinary working environment, not good or not bad.
Weak collaboration among members.
The 1st memory company in the past becomes 4th company in the world now.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: Co-workers were professional and great people to work with. Work was challenging. Not much opportunity for promotion within a team. Saw most people change teams in order to advance.

Title: Excellent to work on new equipment
Review Description: Very rewarding being a shift engineer solving production issues and managing a shift. Development on new models of etchers was exciting and fun. Good team work on new products to pass down to production fabs.

Title: Not the company it once was
Review Description: Micron seems to believe that the way to succeed is to sell its soul. The ultra competitiveness is killing the core of the company. A few mistakes in certain parts of the company have led the company to fall behind and the whole company is suffering as a result.

Title: Top manufacturing company in Singapore
Review Description:
Good place to start your engieering career
Great people and nice working culture

Title: Looking for new career
Review Description: Work for better life and new environment for better post ! Everyday manage to attend meeting either inside or outside group for improvement ! Resolve the issue with better idea

Title: Great place to work
Review Description: Excellent cross-functional collaboration. Team leads are engaged and responsive. Work is challenging, but reasonable. Met a lot of good people here.

Title: Fast paced high tech
Review Description: fast paced high tech company. offers opportunity to learn new things everyday. global company allows international exposure and experience. diversified workforce.

Title: Many health and sports benifits on site. Diversified enviornment.
Review Description: Daily duties included overseeing, training, tracking, visual inspection, testing and packaging on the night shift. I learned many computer applications, product detail and testing product.The hardest part of the job was keeping my team productive when the work flow was slow. This was usually resolved by working closely with other areas to find work they could assist with. I enjoyed both the interaction with co-workers and the problem solving to improve or clarify processes.

Title: very technical and fast-pace.
Review Description:
- a typical day at work is to handle software programs, which is very technical and intensive.
- I have learnt how to code in order to meet the specification.
- the managers are very understandable and give you the best available resources to get the job done.
- my co-workers are very friendly and helpful in many cases.
- the hardest part of the job is to debug the test program and to optimize yields in production.
- the most enjoyable part is to do software.

Title: Great place to work and advance your career
Review Description:
I work full time more than a year at Micron.
Great company to work for. You will have a lot of things to learn to move forward your career goal.
Management is good. Sometimes work-life balance can not be achieved but that is a small issue compared with a lot of good things you will get here.

Title: A Challenging and Good Paying Career
Review Description:
The work at this large company depends on the department you work in.
Some departments offer ample opportunities for advancement and some don't. This is very much dependent on the type of work. In the fabrication facilities, career opportunities are abundant. In R&D type of work, the career is more focused on technical skills (as to be expected).

Title: Productive environment with concise job roles
Review Description: Learned to collaborate as well as drive change, as was needed in our group to bring two different Quality organizations into one in a new company. Learning the methods used on the other technologies, questioning and then determining how and what of these to use on NOR Flash was a learning experience.

Title: Productive and fun place to work
Review Description: Lived in Boise ID. Both city and place of work very unusual and interesting to work. I liked everything there. Very friendly and nice environment and people

Title: productive
Review Description: overall its a great place to work, and everyone is friendly. I would recommend anyone to work there its a great place to work! :)

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: Good place to learn about latest technologies. Technically sound engineers works here. Management is not very clear of the road maps and management styles.

Title: inside work
Review Description: average company to work for. will let you go at their convenience. will definitely make up reasons to get rid of you when they know that layoffs are coming.

Title: nice company
Review Description:
I worked at Micron Technology (More than 4 years)
Pros
Great Company
Good Benefits
Great Opportunities to Grow
Innovation
Cons
More participation in stocks
equal benefits for all

Title: Day at work
Review Description: Being on call 24/7 was very stressful and not really rewarding. But when i wasn't being paged on off hours the typical day was pretty good. get into work clean up messes from the previous night talk and work with italian coworkers. Get lunch and then work on projects which included expanding software solutions and making things generally better for everyone.

Title: Excellent work environment with proper work-life balance.
Review Description:
I was working with extremely experienced team of professionals. My team members were very helpful and friendly. I was easily able to approach anyone with my all questions and they would clear all my doubts very patiently.

Work hours were flexible. I learned a lot from my team members. I was part of Probe PE team. I analyzed digital/analog simulations of test-modes for pre-silicon validation of the product & documented the results.I also created test vectors for regression testing of test-modes and developed a Perl script to automate the regression testing. I also got an opportunity to perform post-silicon validation of a test-mode on Micron’s testers. I was able to learn a lot of new things due to the support and guidance provided by my team.

I was very pleased with the work environment. With a great working environment and team support as in Micron, it is very easy to achieve your goals.

Title: Helpful, friendly colleagues
Review Description: The colleagues here are helpful, friendly and willing to teach. However, there have been far too many rounds of reorganizations with no fruitful results at the end of the day.
Pro: Helpful, friendly colleagues
Con: Weak management, too many reorganizations

Title: Good company in a sunset industry
Review Description: A good place to work and learn skills. However semiconductor is a very volatile industry, you can experience "feast or famine". Micron is no exception.

Title: Good place to work
Review Description: Micron is a big enough company that there is a position for everyone. For the most part they are good to work for but they are big now. It is a different atmosphere.

Title: Great place to work with fun people around
Review Description:
After having an experience of more than 10 years in the industry, i have seen lots of ups and downs and the most important thing this has taught me is to have a positive attitude at all times and never shy away from a challenge. I had the fortune of working with some highly motivated and smart people and am sure that it has made me wiser with time.
I had good rapport with every group i worked in and always learned something new each day.

Title: Company is very innovative and fast paced with cutting edge technology
Review Description:
Evaluate status of equipment, compare the area priorities to the resources available to me to address each need. Stay on top of each issue ensuring proper resources are in place. observe the techs and engineers performance and ensure they are addressing the daily responsibilities as well as their developmental goals.
I continually learn new solutions to new problems from a technology point of view as well a new skills when working with people.
Management empowers leaders to use individual skills to meet area and department goals. My co-workers are driven to meet area, department, company and personal goals. Having to fire someone is probably the hardest part of the job. Integrating inexperienced new employees into an operational team, identifying their key skills, Then finding specific learning opportunities and mentoring them for success.

Title: Can be frustrating with the lack of validation of processes and procedures
Review Description:
Overall a good place to work.
A typical day was just come in and do your work.
Everyone is open to answer any questions and encouraged to do so.
Management was fair to everyone.
Equipment down time was a bit to high.
The most enjoyable part was learning.

Title: Excellent workplace
Review Description: Co-workers are technically very competent, helpful, and contribute to a fun work environment. The hardest part of the job is dealing with project cancellations.

Title: Productive
Review Description:
Learned quite a bit while at Micron. Ariba System and SAP. Great coworkers, hardworking pleasant.
Best part of my job was dealing with the people and vendors, helping them to get what they needed.

Title: Workplace Secure
Review Description: The work shift is 12 hours per day. I worked a week three times a day then the other week of four times a day. I was Quality Inspector for ten years in the company.

Title: Great Company
Review Description:
Most days working was pretty eventful due to the position I was in. Some people would have worse problems then others. Plus helped with IT department to accomplish some bigger tasks at hand.

I had learned how to maintain a network environment even down to the physical data center itself. I would activate patch cables, used a Fox and the Hound to trace a patch cable to the data center, change VLANs to different subnets. Also learned to rack and configure servers.

My manager and coworkers were amazing people, nothing but the best ever came from them. I really enjoyed working with them during the time I had spent at Micron.

Title: ok place to work
Review Description: Micron is a nice diverse place to work but growth and advancements seems to be rare. the most enjoyable part of work to to have to interact with different people from different places

Title: Not easy to advance through company
Review Description: Not very much advancement opportunities available for newer employees. When then more experienced techs wouldn't advance they would force them to move to another department.

Title: They treat you like slave labor.
Review Description: They don't give out raises, add responsibilities (you basically do the work of 2 or 3 people), they make it hard for you to advance, they lie to you to try to keep you. and morale is horrible. I would suggest you work for a different company if you want to be in the semiconductor field.

Title: Just OK
Review Description: Meh. Can't really say good things about it. People were friendly enough I guess. The pay at the time was very poor.

Title: Great work culture and interesting work
Review Description:
Great place, work life balance is great.
Co-workers are amazing and helpful. Nice growth.

Management should take good decisions or needs to change.

Title: Good work life fexibility
Review Description:
Good work life flexibility.
Training is mostly on self-learn web based
Management is not open. No motivations. Changes direction often
Co-workers are nice and helpful
Hardest part of the job is dealing with laid off every 3 years, low manpower to continue the work. Reluctant to change
Most enjoyable part is the teamwork with co-worker

Title: Production driven environment
Review Description: Semiconductor industry is a cyclical industrial with may ups and downs. The downs trends have tendency to eliminate the weaker players. From the peak to now there were 40-50 memory chip makers now we are down to about 4. There not much more to cut and the future of manufacturing in the US will be difficult.

Title: Good company to have work and life balance
Review Description:
It is a big company, which can have work and life balance.
The work pace is slow and there is a lot of meetings everday.

Title: Decent place to work at if you like a good work/life balance
Review Description:
Good pay
Nice work/life balance
Pretty good insurance and heath coverage rates
Co-workers are great to work with
Learned team leading skills

Title: A place where you look forward to go
Review Description:
The Micron culture of work ethic is amazing . For example the people you get to work with in your team are focused on quality and fast execution of the product. As far as human relations go there has been something very special about the workers at Micron. Everyone is positive and always looking to help each other out. The supervisors most of the time go to bat for their team members.

Once you get rolled over you get great medical and you get 401k. In relation to other entry level jobs in the Treasure Valley Micron is overall competitive.

Title: Fabrication Unit
Review Description: Micron is the best company to producing more numbers of Memory chips to the Asia. All Engineers are support to us to do timely correct job and making to increase the Productivity.

Title: Productive and learning hub
Review Description: This Company is maintaining good balance between both employee and management staff, there is no restriction for idea. So each and every person has right to deliver their own idea

Title: Great position in a not so great time.
Review Description: The work at Micron is wonderful, I enjoy what I do and the experience I am gaining. I yearn for more responsibility, however. Micron seems to have every intention of keeping me, but unfortunately I have grown restless.

Title: Desing & Implementation all Critical Systems, Web
Review Description:
Systems Implementation Responsible for critical system installation corporation (Accounting, Inventory, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Cash Banks, Payroll Personnel), and automation of all operations Gathering information on internal processes, for the adequacy of the systems in each specific area. Development Reports required for daily operation of the business, adequacy of all required reports and presented to goverment entities. Title: Modern equipment and Excellent learning opprotunities
Review Description:
As it turned out, my time here was limited at this facility. I worked in the implant and CVD/PVD group. Repaired and assisted in the repair of several types of Equipment types of different manufacturers. Learned different types of equipment and had to learn different types of manufacturing processes to keep up with the effects on the equipment. This was an R&D fab and was very interesting and fun. Co-workers were fun to work with and engineering was very accommodating with cause and effect troubleshooting. This was the most enjoyable part of the job.
The hardest part of the job was attending all the meetings. I know they are necessary to report and give your own reports to the team members, but there were so many that some seemed redundant. The second rough part was a few management types seemed to forget this was an R&D fab, and were running in manufacturing mode, so when we were trying to figure out why equipment or processes were not working, they wanted the equipment cleaned and running. We needed the equipment and the processes running right, seeking quality not quantity. While limiting down time to make the part was important, knowing the reason for failures is more important. The trick was to figure out the correct balance to satisfy both goals....

Title: Work hard and play hard.
Review Description: Micron was a growing company with many challenges and opportunities for advancement. As technicians there we were forced to think outside of the box and constantly pushing the envelope to develop or modify equipment to do things they weren't originally designed to do. The shift was 12 hours long with a 30 minute lunch break and the day started with a pass down from the outgoing shift to bring up to speed with what was going on. The supervisor then discussed the priorities and every one started working. When a piece of equipment was repaired it was put through a series of quality tests and the results were reviewed by a second technician. It it passed all of the test the part was bagged, tagged and placed in inventory. If it failed it was torn down to discover the reason it failed and reworked. For me the toughest part of the job was getting adjusted to night shift because we rotated shifts every four months. The first week of shift change was particularly challenging because of the change in sleep habits.The best part of the job was the feeling of satisfaction you got when you repaired a subassembly and it went into the production area and did not come out until it was pulled because of regularly scheduled maintenance.

Because it is a high volume fab, sometimes the pressure you are under can suck the fun out of a successful repair. I was fortunate enough that most of my peers were folks with good character and a generally good work ethic. I was also able to learn from seasoned technicians who were eager to pass along their knowledge. There is a bit of micro-management going on, but because of the nature of a high volume factory, it goes with the territory. The only real beef with the place I personally have is that promotion can be tough and sometimes you can get stuck where you are at for long time. The 12 hour shifts can be rough and you can lose time with family and friends, but if you're used to it, you almost don't notice it.
Pro: decent pay, good benefits, time off earned quickly
Con: shift work rotating days/nights, micro management, company losses

I was given responsibilities for testing wafers and later encapsulated chips for NAND flash devices. My schedule was flexible, so long as I fulfilled my responsibilities. My co-workers were respectful, and the leadership was great. Weekly meetings with the team leader, a product engineer, were great to learn how all the departments worked together to implement a design.

Had I not left engineering, I would love to work for Micron again, and I highly recommend them to those in the computer manufacturing industry.

Title: Ambiente lavorativo stimolante
Review Description:
La giornata lavorativa in Micron , non si puo' certo definire tipica, in quanto non è una catena di montaggio, si lavora in ambiente sterile e i turni, diurni e notturni, durano dodici ore. Si arriva sul posto di lavoro e si indossano indumenti protettivi atti a non contaminare il materiale in lavorazione (semiconduttori); successivamente si prendono le consegne dal turno precedente, quindi si procede allo svolgimento del lavoro.

Ho imparato la meticolosità nel rispetto delle procedure e grazie a ciò, ho riscontrato che il lavoro prodotto può raggiungere risultati eccellenti.

Non ho mai avvertito l'esigenza di giudicare il management in maniera negativa, consapevole che a volte decisioni prese impopolari erano dovute a politiche aziendali rivolte a più ampi orizzonti.

Il personale dipendente, essendo molto numeroso, non poteva che abbracciare tipologie variegate, personalmente non ho mai avuto problemi con nessuno.

I turni notturni irrimediabilmente alterano l'orologio biologico essendo di dodici ore.

Ho lavorato in un'ambiente dove si utilizzavano soprattutto terminologie e software in lingua inglese, di conseguenza ero proiettata in contesti internazionali e questo mi ha arricchito professionalmente.
